loans.name: Denith

texts.en:
Denith is a married woman who has three children. Denith is thirty years old, and resides at Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Denith owns and operates farm land, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, and earns PHP 2,000 a month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 6,300 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2011, Denith joined GDMPC. In the future, Denith wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, aged fifty-two, operates sari-sari store business. She also sells local cakes in the elementary school in the village as additional income. She is patiently doing these activities for the welfare of her five children. 

Cecilia is now requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy bread, spices, noodles, flour, milk and sugar used to make local cakes.  With this loan amount, she is hoping to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy bread, spices, noodles, flour, milk and sugar to make local cakes.

loans.name: Yern

texts.en:
Yern, forty-nine, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about USD 3 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who can earn about USD 3 per day. 

Yern is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase tiles to cover her house’s roof. This money would enable her to finish her house’s construction. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop with her daughter and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase tiles to cover her house's roof.

loans.name: Eulyjean

texts.en:
Eulyjean is forty-two years old and is engaged in a hog-fattening business as a source of livelihood. With this occupation, she provides for her family’s needs and wants. For the nineteen years she has been working in this business, she has worked patiently due to her love for her family. 

Right now, to satisfy also the needs of her hogs, Eulyjean is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine. She is looking after her hogs so well because they will provide her with a high income after 5 or 6 months. Hopefully, with her unending hard work she will achieve her dream profit.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine for her hogs.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with two children. Elvie is thirty-two years old and lives in Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines.

Elvie is a farmer and she produces vegetables and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earns PHP 3,600 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Elvie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Elvie hopes to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kathleen Joy

texts.en:
Kathleen Joy is 23 years old and widowed with 2 children.

Kathleen Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Kathleen Joy has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Kathleen Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Charlie is from the village of Gauyabal. He is 45 years old. He is married to Teresita and they have been blessed with six children. Charlie is engaged in a transportation business using his motorcycle. He has been engaged in his business for a year. He usually receives an income of PHP 300 a day.  Charlie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. Charlie still hopes to find ways to provide for his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a married woman who has three children. Emilda is 47 years old and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Emilda own and operates farmland, planting and harvesting durian (a fruit) for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Earlier this year, Emilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Emilda wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old, married to Marry, and blessed with two children. He owns a music stall/shop and has been selling music discs and movies for the last 5 years. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a music player and television.  

His hopes are to expand his business to operate as a registered company and start a music production studio.

loans.use: to buy a music player and television

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch, 54,  resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of purchasing rice for resale for over ten years, earning approximately USD9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD9 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Toch is requesting a loan of USD800 as capital for her business.  By doing so, she will make more profit to support the family. 

In the future, Toch would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her youngest child get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business of purchasing rice for resale

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is from Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Emelyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Emelyn plants & harvests decorative plants for sale. Emelyn has been in this business for 4 years and earns 1,800 PHP a month for these activities. Emelyn is requesting a loan of 4,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more seeds to plant. In 2009, Emelyn joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds to plant

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los jazmines las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que la dueña de la casa donde se reúnen tiene un pequeño jardín donde tiene plantados 3 jazmines, esta historia es acerca de la señora quintila quien cuenta con 54 años de edad y es viuda desde hace mas de 10 años, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo aleida estudia cursa el segundo año de prepa, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de carne, chorizo y pollos desde hace  7 años.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a su hijo adelante y gozar de una mejora calidad de vida, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más carne, chorizo y pollos para continuar con su negocio. 

Doña quintila está muy contenta porque dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes e ingresos, tanto que hasta está ahorrando para asegurar la educación de su hija y así pueda tener una buena carrera profesional.

La meta que ella dice tener para su negocio es la de continuar invirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que lo que en verdad desea es construir un pequeño local para poner su carnicería, para tener mejores ventas y mejor surtido y así mismo obtener mas y mejores ganancias.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de las integrantes del grupo los jazmines.
Elsa, Ruth, quintila, lucia, Alejandra, salvador, norma, María del rosario, Eusebia, flora, María, santa cruz y María Eugenia, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, zapatos, perfumes, comida, ropa, frutería, panadería, etc.
texts.en:
This group is named Los Jazmines.  The members decided to give it this name because the owner of the house where they meet has a small garden with three jasmine plants.

This story is about Quintila, who is 54 years old and a widow for more than ten years.  She has six children, of whom only Aleida is a student; she is in the second year of high school.  All the others are already married.  She has worked selling meat, chorizo, and chicken for seven years.  She decided to get into this business because she wanted to find the way to get her child ahead and to have a better quality of life.

She is going to invest the loan she received in buying more meat, chorizo, and chicken to continue with her business.

Quintila is very happy because she says it is going very well for her with her business.  Her sales have increased a lot, as well as her customers and income, so much so that she is saving to guarantee her daughter's education.  In this way her daughter can have a good professional career.

The goal she says she has for her business is to continue investing in her business to make it grow quickly, because what she really wants is to build a small store to set up her butcher shop to have better sales and stock as well as more and better profits.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for the unconditional support they are giving because, thanks to this help, she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

These are the names and jobs of every one of the members of the Los Jazmines group: Elsa, Ruth, Quintila, Lucia, Alejandra, Salvador, Norma, María del Rosario, Eusebia, Flora, María, Santa Cruz, and María Eugenia, who work in different businesses such as groceries, cosmetics sales, shoes, perfume, food, clothing, greengrocer, bakery, etc.

loans.use: to buy more meat, chorizo, and chicken.

loans.name: Musaenda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Musaenda esta integrado por 15 personas cada una de ellas realiza una actividad económica con la intención de dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, este grupo se encuentra ubicado  en la comunidad de Campo Experimental la cual se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera su gente se dedica al cultivo y siembra de caña otra de las actividades es la recolección de resina de árbol de hule.

Doña Maria del Carmen es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 66 años y es viuda, ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 4 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio a si que abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes en su casa con la cual a tenido exito ya que siempre la tiene surtida y da una buena atencion a sus clientes, doña maria nos dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que no gracias a el a salido adelante y siempre esta en contacto con la gente de su comunidad. ella invertira este credito en la Compra de arroz, frijol, azucar, aceite, sal, jabon , cloro, dulces, refrescos, jugos, chile, tomate, cebolla y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio.
ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Leoba venta de dulces 
Pascuala venta de perfumes
maria del rosario venta de refrescos 
Liliana venta de antojitos 
Margarita venta de refrescos 
Maria del mar reposteria
Liliana Keren venta de antojitos
Antonia venta de ropa
Deysi venta zapatos 
Eva Janet papeleria
Senobia venta de de cosmeticos
Maria salome venta de dulces
Alexis ciber
Eva venta de frituras


este grupo agradece a la fundación el préstamo y la confianza que se le ha dado.
texts.en:
The Musaenda group has 15 members, each one of whom works so as to give their families a better quality of life.  The group is located in the community of Campo Experimental, which is a sugar-cane region, dedicated to growing and harvesting cane, as well as collecting sap from rubber trees.

Doña Maria del Carmen is one of the group's members. She is 66 years old and a widow.  She tells us that a little more than four years ago, she decided to start her own business, and she opened a small grocery store in her home, which has been a success, since she always gives her clients good service. Doña Maria says she enjoys her work, as it has allowed her to get ahead and to always be in contact with the people of her community.

She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, soap, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chiles, tomatoes, onions, and canned goods to restock her business.  

She hopes this loan will help her business to keep growing and give her a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are:
Leoba, who sells sweets  
Pascuala, who sells perfumes
Maria del Rosario, who sells soft drinks
 Liliana, who sells snacks 
Margarita, who sells soft drinks 
Maria del Mar, pastries
Liliana Keren, who sells snacks
Antonia, who sells clothing
Deysi, who sells shoes
Eva Janet, who has a paper store
Senobia, who sells cosmetics
Maria Salome, who sells sweets 
Alexis, cyber cafe
Eva, who sells fried food.

This group thanks Kiva partner Fundacion Realidad A.C (FRAC) for the loan and the confidence it has placed in them.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, salt, soap, bleach, sweets, soft drinks juices, chiles, tomatoes, onion, and canned goods.

loans.name: Las Limonarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo las limonarias esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales son muy alegres y amables. Este grupo esta ubicado en una zona cañera y su gente se dedica al trabajo del campo a la siembra y cultivo de caña y todos sus pobladores hablan el dialecto mazateco.

La señora juana es uno de los integrates de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de de 40 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor federico que trabaja en el campo, ellos tienen dos hijos federico de 19 años y juan carlos de 17 años los cuales trabajan.

Doña Juana Platica que hace poco mas de 10 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes para ganar un poco mas de dinero extra y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña juana esta ubicado en un pequeño local junto a su casa en el cual vende abarrotes, verduras, refrescos y dulces.

Doña Juana dice que con el paso de los años a ganado muchos clientes por eso siempre le gusta tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus clientela siempre encuentre lo que busquen. Ella invertira este credito en la Compra de arroz, frijol, azucar, aceite, sal, jabon , cloro, dulces, refrescos, jugos, chile, tomate, cebolla y productos enlatados para resurtir su negocio.

ella desea que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando ya que sus ganancias las quiere invertir en mas mercancia. 

los demas integrantes del grupo:

Paola abarrotes
Carmen ropa
Maria Magdalena refrescos
Margarita antojitos 
Francisca articulos para el hogar 
Felipa panaderia
Juliana refrescos
Cevero taller de bicicletas
Flora dulces
Roberta refrescos
texts.en:
The Limonarias group has 11 members, who are a very happy and friendly bunch.  This group is located in a sugar-cane region, and its members work in the fields, harvesting and cultivating cane; the whole population speaks the Mazateco language.
 
Juana is one of the group's members.  She is 40 years old.  She studied to high-school level.  She is married to Federico, who works in the fields, and they have two children: Federico, 19, and Juan Carlos, 17, who are also working.

Doña Juana says that a bit more than 10 years ago, she decided to open her own business selling groceries to gain some extra money and thereby help her husband with the household expenses. Juana's business is located in a little shop next to their house, where she sells groceries, vegetables, soft drinks, and sweets.

Doña Juana says that over the years, she has gained many clients, and for this reason she always likes to keep her shop well stocked.  That way, her clients can always find what they are looking for.  She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, soap, bleach, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chiles, tomatoes, onions, and canned goods with which to restock her shop.

She hopes this loan will help her business to keep growing, as she will to invest her earnings in buying more merchandise.


The other members of the group are:

Paola, groceries
Carmen, clothing
Maria Magdalena, soft drinks
Margarita, snacks
Francisca, housewares 
Felipa, bakery
Juliana, soft drinks
Cevero, bicycle workshop
Flora, sweets
Roberta, soft drinks

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, soap, bleach, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chiles, tomatoes, onions, and canned goods.

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon, 40, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over seven years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a business of carrying dirt to sell. He earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are a garment worker and a construction worker. Approximately, they earn USD 7 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Savon is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of land for her husband to dig the dirt to sell. By doing so, he will make more income to support the family.

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for her husband to dig the dirt to sell

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, 30, is married and resides with her mother, her husband, and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of buying poultry to resell for over four years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her business, Chenda is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her business to purchase more poultry to resell. By doing so, she will make more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house for her mother to live separately in.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to purchase more poultry to resell

loans.name: Sect 17 Wendaobo Group

texts.fr:
Mme VERONIQUE est la représentante du groupe SECTEUR  17 WENDAOBO. Elle est veuve et mère de six(06) enfants. Le plus âgé a 42 ans et le moins âgé a 22 ans. Parmi ses enfants un (01) va à l’école. Elle a trois (03) personnes en charge.

	Mme est vendeuse de bois et charbon depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne par chargement dans les villages. Ses clients sont des hommes et des femmes.

	Mme veut s’acheter cinq (05) chargements (camions) de bois.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne augmenter son stock en bois.
texts.en:
Veronique is the representative of the SECTEUR 17 WENDAOBO group. She is a widow, and mother of six children. Her eldest child is 42 years old, and her youngest child is 22. One of her children goes to school. She has three people living in her care.

Veronique has been selling wood and coal for ten years now. She buys her supplies by the load in the villages. She has both male and female customers.

She wants to buy five truckloads of wood.

She uses the profit that she makes to support her family. She is striving to increase her supply of wood.

loans.use: to buy five truckloads of wood

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old. He is married to Elisa. To make a living, Jose provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for more six months and earns approximately 300 PHP daily.

Right now, Jose is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is involved in the retailing business. She is 46 years old and blessed with four children. Running a sari-sari (variety) store occupies the daily schedule of Marcelina. She usually generates an income of about PHP 300 a day. She utilizes the business profit for meals and paying monthly electric bills.

Right now, Marcelina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, kitchen needs, soft drinks, candies, noodles and bread to sell in her store. She is hoping to meet her customers' demand with affordable prices of merchandise she offers. She also would like to save funds to use in times of emergency.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, kitchen needs, soft drinks, candies, noodles and bread to sell in her store

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 47, is widowed and resides with her father and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker who receives support from her children. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. 

Nary wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Nary is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and help her children get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Theriza

texts.en: Theriza is a married woman with two school-aged children. She has a general store where she sells a variety of products. She has been doing this work for four years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 300. Theriza is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell to the people of the community. She hopes that, through the loan, she can obtain more customers. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to allow her to cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, sugar, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim, 28, is married and resides with her father, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a bicycle repair shop. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Lim is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband to resell. This purchase would enable him to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts for her husband to resell

loans.name: Las Comadres Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Celestina va a comprar con su préstamo suéteres, pantalones, chamarras, playeras, pans, la señora Gloria va a comprar pollos. La señora Celestina tiene 44 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ella tiene 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y un varón todos estudian las mujeres están una en el CBTA, otra en bachilleres y otra en la secundaria y el varón estudia la licenciatura y trabaja, ella vende telas, ropa, hueles, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar telas, hules pans, suéteres, calcetas, ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años por necesidades económicas y vio que en el mercado nadie vendía telas y hules, ella tiene su local en el mercado de la comunidad, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ganancias para mejorar y comprar alimento para sus cerdos, a ella le gusta atender a sus cliente se siente orgullosa de beneficiar a sus clientes con buenos precios en los productos sus clientes son alumnos, señoras, jóvenes. Sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir progresando en su negocio y que sus hijos se queden con el negocio a quien le guste este negocio. Ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a invertir en su negocio para que se vea más bonito y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por darnos la oportunidad con su prestamos mejoramos los negocios invertimos y crecen los negocio”.
texts.en:
The new members of the group are Sra. Celestina, who is going to buy sweaters, pants, jackets, shirts and sweatpants and Sra. Gloria who is going to buy chickens.

Celestina is 44 years old and lives in a common-law union with her husband. She has 4 children, three female and one male and all are studying. The young women are in the CBTA (Centro de Bachillerato Tecnológico Agropecuario) [Vocational High School for Farming and Animal Husbandry], a high school graduate and in secondary school and the male is studying for a bachelor’s degree and is working.

Celestina sells fabric, clothing, rubber flip flops and she is applying for a loan to buy fabric, flip flops, sweaters and socks.  She began her business 6 years ago by necessity and saw that in the market no-one was selling fabric and rubber flip flops. She has a space in the community market and her business is important because she earns income to improve and purchase food for her pigs. 

 She enjoys waiting on her clients and is proud to help her customers, by charging reasonable prices for her products. Her customers include students, women and other youth. Her dreams and hopes are to continue being successful in her business and that her children take over the business eventually, those who would enjoy doing so.  

Celestina is happy with the loan she is going to receive and will invest it in her business so that it will be more attractive and provide better service to her customers.  

The members of the group want to say to KIVA and Fundación Realidad “Thank you very much for giving us the opportunity, through your loans, of  improving our business by investing in and expanding them.”

loans.use: to buy fabric, flip flops, sweatpants, sweaters and socks

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho, 37, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over ten years, has extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, she earns USD 3 per day. Her husband carries ice cream to sell in the local community. He earns about USD 8 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Tho is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry ice cream to sell. This purchase would enable her husband to carry ice cream to sell in larger amounts and thus earn more profit. 

In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and help her children get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry ice cream to sell

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a 34-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She manages a sari-sari (variety) store, a community based store where she sells different products. She is a very responsible woman who is able to support her family. Juvy is asking for a loan of P12,000 to purchase other products such as drinks, shampoo, soap and spices for as additional inventory to sell and have additional income to cover the needs of her family.

In the future, Juvy hopes that her store will expand so that she can give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, shampoo, soap and spices for her store

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion a very hardworking mother with five grown-up children. She is 58 years old and married to Moises. They live in a village in Aggasian province in Isabela. She is engaged in a hog raising business. In that reason she is requesting a loan of P 12,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and sell in the future and also feed to fatten her pigs. She dreams that someday her business will expand so that she can cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Zurah

texts.en: Zurah is 29 years old and married with one child. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: La señora Victoria es nueva integrante del grupo ella solicito su préstamo para comprar ropa interior de dama brasier, pantaletas, fondos, bikinis, las otras integrantes se dedican a la actividad que vienen desarrollando, La señora Victoria tiene 45 años de edad, ella es casada, ella tiene un hijo varón que estudia la primaria,  ella vende ropa interior de dama como brassier, fondos, pantaletas, bikinis, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años con unos ahorros que tenia de su trabajo anterior, ella sale a vender sus productos de casa en casa los días domingos, su negocio importante porque obtiene ingresos para su hijo que está estudiando, a ella le gusta vender la ropa interior, atender amablemente a sus clientas las señoras y muchachas , ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a invertir y para los gastos de su hijo, sus sueños y esperanzas son que crezca su negocio, luchar para que su hijo que sea una persona responsable y trabajadora. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, “estamos muy agradecidos con ustedes con sus préstamos podemos invertir y ganar, que bueno que hay personas que les gusta ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan”.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a new member of the group. She is applying for a loan to purchase women’s underwear such as brassieres, panties, underskirts and bikinis. The other members are engaged in businesses that they are establishing.

Victoria is 45 years old, married and has a son in primary school. She sells women’s underwear such as brassieres, underskirts, panties and bikinis and she started her business three years ago with some savings she had from a previous job. She sells her products door to door on Sundays. Her business is important because she earns income for her son, who is, as noted, in school.

She enjoys selling underwear and waits affably on her customers, women and girls. She uses her profits to reinvest in her business and to pay her child’s expenses. Her dreams and hopes are that her business will grow and that her son will be a responsible and hardworking person.

The members of the group want to say to KIVA and Fundación Realidad, “We are very grateful for our loans that enable us to invest and earn an income. It is so good that there are people who enjoy helping those who need it.”

loans.use: to purchase brassieres, underskirts, panties and bikinis.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie is a married woman with five children. Jenie is 45 years old and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She operates a fish selling business while her husband catches river fish to earn a living, and she's been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. 

In 2010, Jenie joined GDMPC. In the future, Jenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en:
Gleen is married with three children. She is 30 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gleen owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 4,400 to purchase chemicals to improve farm production. 

Gleen has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Gleen's plan is to save her returns in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to improve farm production

loans.name: Renson

texts.en: Renson is 41 years old and is married with three children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 13 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he has a motorcycle transport business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plastic chairs and carpets to sell.

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs and carpets to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and is married. She is from the village of Del Pilar, and she has been engaged in buying and selling medicines in the local community. She has been in this business for six months. Maricel wants to expand her business and she wants also to have her own stall. 

In this regard, Maricel is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more medicines to sell. She is hoping that her business will further grow to secure her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Percy Gerardo

texts.es:
Percy es un esposo amoroso y un padre ejemplar, de 2 maravillosos jóvenes de 19 ,16 y una hija de 17 años, a los cuales ama muchísimo y por los cuales da la vida y se esfuerza a diario para sacarlos adelante para que sean personas de bien y sean felices, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas y sobre todo la generosidad de su gente. Percy es un hombre trabajador con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la bodega que tiene en su vivienda, pero también trabaja en una panificadora en horas de la mañana en especial a las 5 de la mañana, ya que el nos comenta que siempre un dinerito extra es bueno; su  negocio de abarrotes lleva ya 3 años, 3 años en los cuales ha sabido ganarse la simpatía de los clientes, por ello el  cree que le va bien en su negocio.

Percy está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gracias ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras para su negocio como reparar el techo ya que actualmente es de caña de Guayaquil con barro, también cambiara su portón ya que actualmente ya esta viejito y oxidado y también cambiar su puerta ya que como es de manera está totalmente apolillada y también comprar andamios, asi podra tener mayor seguridad en su negocio y brindar mas comodidad a los clientes que van a su negocio, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y hacer realidad su gran sueño.” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y lo más importante que sean felices”.
texts.en:
Percy is a loving husband and perfect father.  He has 3 wonderful children: 2 sons, ages 19 and 16, and a daughter who is 17.  He loves his children very much and works hard every day in raising them to be decent and happy individuals.  Their home is located in the city of Imperial.  The city is well known for its hot climate, its beautiful beaches, and above all, for the generosity of its people.

Percy is a very hard worker, and through much effort and saving he managed to start his grocery business.  He sells groceries at a store that he set up in his home, though he also works at a bakery in the mornings, often starting work at 5 AM.  Percy says that it is always good to have the extra money.  He has had his grocery business for 3 years now.  During that time he has won the affection of his customers, which is why he thinks his business is going well.
 
Percy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since their support will allow him to make improvements to his business.  These include repairing his roof, which is made of bamboo and clay, as well as replacing his gate, which is old and rusty.  He also intends to replace his door, which has become totally worm-eaten, and to purchase scaffolding.  These improvements will ensure that Percy has better security for his business and can provide his customers with more comfort when they visit his shop.  The improvements will also allow Percy to keep working and to achieve his biggest dream: for his children to find good professions and, most importantly, for them to be happy.

loans.use: to repair the roof and replace the gate and front door of his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Obreras esta integrado por doce personas amables y trabajadoras cada una de ellas tiene una actividad economica, este grupo esta ubicado en La colonia Obrera del ingenio la margarita, los habitantes de esta comunidad se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de caña y algunos otros trabajan como obreros en el ingenio. 

Jose Manuel es uno de los miembros de este grupo, el tiene la edad de 48 años, estudio la preparatoria y es soltero. Jose Manuel nos platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y abrio en un pequeño local que tiene en su casa una refresqueria la cual a crecido con el paso de los años y actualmente no solo vende refresco sino también abarrotes y dulces. El platica que en estos años su tienda a ganado muchos clientes ya que siempre  esta bien surtida y atender amablemente a sus clientes para que para que siempre vuelvan a hacerle el gasto. Jose manuel abre su negocio todos los dias desde muy temprano y cierra hasta que se va el ultimo cliente. El invertira este credito en la Compra de arroz, frijol, azucar, aceite, sal, jabon , cloro, dulces, refrescos, jugos, chile, tomate, cebolla y productos enlatados para resurtir el negocio.
el espera que con esta inversion sus ventas y sus ganancias aumenten para que continue haciendo crecer el negocio y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.


los demas integrantes del grupo son:
 vicenta venta de comida 
Cristina venta de abarrotes
Narcisa papeleria
Juana venta de calzado 
Federico reparacion de lavadoras
Margarits venta de ropa interior
Georgina  venta de ropa de cama
Mary Cruz Venta de calzado 
isabel venta de cosmeticos 
Andrea venta de perfumes
Coral venta de perfumes
texts.en:
The Las Obreras group has twelve friendly and hard-working members. Each of them has a business. This group is located in the worker community of the la margarita cane sugar mill. This community’s inhabitants grow and harvest sugar cane and others work as skilled workers at the cane sugar mill.

Jose Manuel is one of the members in this group. He is 48 years old. He went to high school and he is single. He tells us that a little more than six years ago, he decided to start working at his own business. He opened a small business in his house, a beverage store. It has grown over the years and now, he doesn’t only sell beverages. He also sells groceries and sweets. He says that in these years, his store has gained lots of customers since his store always is well stocked and he happily tends to his customers, so that they always return. Jose Manuel opens his store every day very early and closes when the last customer leaves. He will invest this loan in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, soap, bleach, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chilies, tomatoes, onions and canned goods in order to restock his business. He hopes that this investment will increase his sales and earnings so that he can continue growing his business and he will be able to have a better quality of life.

The other members of the group are: Vicenta - food sales Cristina - grocery sales Narcisa - stationery store Juana - shoe sales Federico - washing machine repairs Margarita - underwear sales Georgina - bedding sales Mary Cruz - shoe sales Isabel - cosmetic sales Andrea -perfume sales Coral -perfume sales

loans.use: purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, soap, bleach, sweets, soft drinks, juices, chilies, tomatoes, onions and canned goods.

loans.name: Robin

texts.es:
Robin, trabaja como chofer en una empresa en el departamento de Potosí y viaja constantemente.
El crédito lo necesita para pagar los estudios de su hijo menor.
Robin, es viudo y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja por quinta vez junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA. El crédito se encuentra bien respaldado, pues presenta garantía prendaria y personal.
texts.en:
Robin works as a driver for a firm in Potosí Department; he travels constantly.  He needs the loan to pay for his minor son’s schooling.  Robin is a widower and has two children he lives with in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.

This is the fifth time he’s worked with IMPRO and the third time with KIVA.  The loan is well backed because he’s guaranteeing it with property and personally.

loans.use: to pay his son's school fees.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam ahora se dedica completamente a la venta de cosméticos y a la venta de productos de belleza para ambos sexos de forma independiente.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más productos al por mayor, cremas de limpieza, maquillajes, desodorantes, etc., para diversificar su mercadería y de esta forma obtener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Miriam, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona de San Pedro la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Miriam is now totally dedicated to independent cosmetics and beauty products sales for both genders.   She needs the loan to buy more products at wholesale: cleansing creams, make-up, deodorant, etc. to diversify her merchandise and obtain more income to support her family this way.

Miriam is married and has two children she lives with in a rented house in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  This is the second time she’s worked with IMPRO and second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 58 years old and married to Diosdado. She manages a store where she sells various products to members of the community. She is a very responsible mother who is able to support her family. Josefina is requesting a loan of P 9,000 to buy different products to sell in the community. She hopes that her business will do well so that she can expand her business and she can cover the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice and snack foods for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is married and has three children. Julieta is 55 years old, and resides at Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Julieta plants, harvests and sells cassava for a living and she's been three years in this business. Each month, she gets 1,500 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC. In the future, Julieta wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Irene has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from hog raising. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to expand her business and to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles and other miscellaneous items.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Loddy

texts.en:
Loddy is thirty-one years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Loddy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks.

Loddy has been raising ducks for two years and also earns additional income from retailing eggs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is thirty-four years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Philippines. She's the mother of one child. Mary Jane has been a cassava farm-owner for two years having availed herself of a loan from GDMPC. 

The farm is providing her with an income of PHP 2,000 a month. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant. In 2009, she become a partner of GDMPC and Kiva. The amount she get from her farm will be used to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and young seeds to plant.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is thirty-two years old, married, with one child. She lives in the village of Aggasian in the province of Isabela. She manages a store in the community. She is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase additional products to sell to the community. Chona is well known as a very diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 69 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has an Avon products and herbal medicines retail business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her grandchildren to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Mae is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Mae is 25 years old and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Mae has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Ma. Mae has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maternidad

texts.en:
Maternidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maternidad requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Maternidad has been in this business for ten years now, and also earns additional income from selling snack food.

In the future, she wants to save money to expand her business and send her kid to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, durante el financiamiento ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, su mayor sueño de la emprendedora es tener variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para  invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos como golosinas, granos básicos, shampoo, aceite, huevos, pan, detergente entre otros productos que sus clientes demandan.
texts.en:
Andrea is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000.  During the loan period she’s shown herself to be a responsible person with a drive to improve.  Her greatest dream is to have a variety of merchandise to offer her customers.  

She is asking for a loan at present to invest in the business buying products like snacks, basic grains, shampoo, oil, eggs, bread and detergent among other products her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 60 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Iluminada requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Iluminada has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Iluminada would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additonal fish to sell

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 32 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Emilda works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling of Avon products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Emilda has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, perfumes, shoes, etc. 

In the future Emilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Norhoda

texts.en:
Norhoda works hard to support her family. Norhoda is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Norhoda has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Norhoda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenence

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia works hard to support her family. Vivencia is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish business in the Philippines.

Vivencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maritta

texts.en:
Maritta is fifty-seven years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maritta is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maritta has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married with two children. Rowena is thirty years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rowena is a farmer and she produces coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earns PHP 1,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Rowena has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rowena hopes to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marfe works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marfe is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Marfe has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is sixty-nine years old, a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercedita has a general store business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods like shampoo, soft-drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

She has been in this business for twelve years. Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like shampoo, soft-drinks, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Ninia

texts.en:
Ninia is forty-four years old and married with three children.

Ninia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Ninia has borrowed and paid for three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending and a coffee shop.

Ninia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is forty-seven years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.  

Dominga is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dominga has been involved in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed twenty-nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dominga would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ndioba

texts.fr:
Madame Ndioba est une dame de 58 ans, mariée et mère de grands enfants maintenant. Cela fait longtemps qu’elle fait du commerce depuis au moins 30 ans déjà.  Elle vend de la vaisselle, des tissus, mais aussi des produits alimentaires comme le tamarin, les dattes, le lait gloria qu’elle achète à partir de la Mauritanie. Ndioba est une habituée du guichet car elle a d’abord fait parti d’un groupement avant de chercher son propre carnet. 
Avec ce crédit, elle veut faire le même circuit pour diversifier un peu en voulant honorer aussi une commande de son voisinage : des tissus, des draps de lit, du savon...
Ndioba participe activement à la gestion du foyer car c’est elle qui s’occupe de payer les factures d’électricité de la maison. Dans le même sens elle souhaiterait voir son activité grandir afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndioba is 58 years old, married and mother of children who are now grown up. She has had a business selling goods for a long time, over 30 years now. She sells dishes, fabric and foodstuffs, such as tamarinds, dates and Gloria milk that she buys in Mauritania. Ndioba is familiar with the branch because she was first a member of a group before seeking her own, individual loans.

With this loan, she wants to do the same in order to diversify a bit and fulfill an order placed by her neighbors: fabrics, bed sheets, soap...

Ndioba participates actively in managing her home. She's the one who takes care of paying the electricity bills for the house. She would like to grow her business in order to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dishes intended for resale, and foodstuffs (tamarind, dates)

loans.name: Las Luchadoras De Tierra Blanca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las luchadoras de tierra blanca los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque se consideran personas que luchan día a día para mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia, también porque así se llama su comunidad, la historia es acerca de la señora Reyna bedsabet ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 44 años de edad y es viuda, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo Miguel y Manuel estudian, cursan segundo año de prepa y segundo año de primaria, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva más de 13 años.

Doña Reyna decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para sacar a sus hijos adelante ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como: leche, arroz, frijol, aceite, sal, galletas, refrescos, pastas para sopa, huevos, jabón y papel higiénico, para tener un poco mas surtido.
 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere ampliar su local para poner su abarrotería y así tener un amplio surtido, para incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que solo así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan tener una muy buena profesión y también seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Reyna bedsabet son: Juana, Rafaela, clemencia, felicísima, rosa y aurea quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: abarrotes, venta de comida, refrescos, venta de pollos, carne, plásticos y frutería.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Luchadoras de Tierra Blanca” and the members decided on this name because they consider themselves to be people who strive daily to improve their lives and the lives of their families and also because that’s the name of their community.  

The story is about Reyna Bedsabet since she’s the group representative.  She’s 44 years old and a widow.  She has four children of which only Miguel and Manuel are attending school; they are in second year of high school and second grade of elementary school.  The two older ones are married.  She has had a grocery store for more than 13 years.

Reyna decided to start this business because she needed to improve her and her family’s quality of life and also to move her children forward since she did not have sufficient economic solvency to provide them with a better education.  The loan she got will be used to buy more merchandise like: milk, rice, beans, oil, salt, cookies, soft-drinks, noodles for soup, eggs, soap and toilet paper in order to have more varied stock.

She wants to continue investing in her business so that she can make it grow much more because she wants to enlarge the locale to install her grocery store and have a wider selection of goods to increase and improve sales and income because this is the only way she will be able to continue supporting her children with their schooling so that they can have good professions and continue to improve their quality of life.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad because thanks to them she’s getting ahead and has been able to have her own business.

Some of Reyna Bedsabet’s other group members are Juana, Rafaela, Clemencia, Felicísima, Rosa and Aurea who carry out a variety of activities like grocery sales, food sales, sale of refreshments, chicken sales, meat, plastics and fruit.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Crisaldy

texts.en:
Crizaldy is 30 years old, a responsible father. He and his wife Amiva have two children. He operates a business buying and selling cell phone accessories, cell phones and motor parts as a source of income. He has been in this business for the past seven years and her wife helps him in improving their business. 


And to develop his business, Crizaldy is asking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy cell phones cases, new models of cell phones, chargers and helmets.


He hopes to expand his business in order to gain higher income and prosperous living conditions. He will also save funds for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to buy cell phone cases, new models of cell phones, chargers and helmets

loans.name: Teodorica

texts.en:
Teodorica is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Teodorica is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Teodorica has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other materials for her business.

Teodorica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Teodorica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Monina has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Monina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is forty-three years old. She is a hardworking woman who raises hogs for future sale; she established the enterprise to increase her income. She lives with her parents in the village of Nagrumbuan. 

Myrna is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs. With proper growth and nutrition, she can sell them for a good price, thereby increasing her income. Myrna aims to have a business well-diversified and establish a stable income for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Seum

texts.en:
Seum, sixty-four, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening-up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. 

Seum wants to run an additional business in order to improve her family’s economy. Therefore, Seum is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry ice to sell in the village. This purchase would enable her to generate extra income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run groceries store from home and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry ice to sell in the village.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is thirty-two years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, she operates a coconut production business. She has been in her business for five years and gets PHP 2,200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is fifty-two years old, married, with four grown up children. She is a vendor who sells different vegetables to the community. Flordeliza is very hardworking person and she plants vegetables in her backyard. 

To have additional income she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy squash, eggplants and bananas for her business. In the future, Flordeliza hopes that her business will expand so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplants and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is forty-eight years old, married and has eight children, four of whom are in school.

Encarnacion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Encarnacion requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Encarnacion has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Encarnacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is sixty years old, married, with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pilar has a salt and shrimp-paste-making business in the Philippines. Pilar requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her shrimp-paste making.

Pilar has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her shrimp paste.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Donalyn

texts.en:
A very young married woman, Donalyn is 26 years old. She has managed a store for eight years and she earns approximately P 2,000 a month. To have additional products to sell, Donalyn is asking for a loan of P 5,000 to purchase rice, snack foods and drinks for her store. 

Donalyn dreams that someday she can build a store in front of their house so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, spices, snack food and drinks for her store

loans.name: Ma. Loreta

texts.en:
Ma. Loreta is from the village of Nagrumbuan. She is 47 years old and is married to Gilbert, a farmer in their village. Ma. Loreta has been engaged in hog-raising business for  a long time and she usually earns PHP 7,000 when she sells her raised hogs. 

Ma. Loreta wants to buy additional piglets to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Ma. Loreta is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, 52, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling noodles for over three years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 6 per day. 

Khorn wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Khorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase timbers to rebuild her house. This money will help her to finish her house building and provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to rebuild her house

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 53-year-old married woman with two children, ages 27 and 18. Her husband works as a fisherman. Bonifacia is also involved in fishing. She helps her husband with their business by selling his catch at the market. She also buys more fish from other fishermen in their town. According to her, their monthly income from fishing is 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

Bonifacia is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights. Bonifacia hopes for their business to grow and for her family to be in good health always.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights.

loans.name: Blanca Ometepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Blanca Ometepec los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, ya que así se llama la persona quien formo el grupo, es por eso que decidieron nombrarlo de esta manera, esta historia es acerca de la blanca ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 30 años de edad y está casada con el señor armando con quien tiene 3 hijos, Carlos, Luis Ángel y Erika, quienes cursan primero y cuarto año de primaria y la más pequeña tercer año de preescolar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hacen más de 10 años.

Doña blanca se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para ofrecerles una muy buena educación a sus pequeños hijos, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de playeras, camisa, uniformes deportivos y también para material como son: hilos, telas, tijeras, cierres, botones por mayoreo, y así continuar con la elaboración de sus prendas.

El sueño que ella tiene es el de ampliar un poco mas su local para tenerla mucho mas surtida con variedad de prendas y así continuar con sus ventas, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios ya que así podrán tener  una buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho, su vida y la de su familia también cambiara.

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: blanca-tienda de ropa, francisca-venta de leche, Claudia, taller de costura, Juana-lavandería, jonaz-abarrotes y Maribel-venta de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
This group is called “Blanca Ometepec.” The members of the group decided on this name because that’s the name of the person who formed the group and that’s why they decided to give it that name.

This story is about Blanca who is one of the group members.  She’s 30 years old, married to Armando and they have three children: Carlos, Luis Ángel and Erika, who are attending first and fourth grade and the youngest is in third year of preschool.  She has been making clothes for over ten years.

Blanca decided on this business because she says she wanted to find a way to improve her quality of life and that of her family and also to offer her little children a good education.  She will use the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, sport uniforms and also supplies like thread, fabric, scissors, zippers and buttons at wholesale to continue making her articles of clothing.

Her dream is to expand her locale a bit more to have it better stocked with articles of clothing and continue with her sales this way because this way she will obtain more and better income to continue supporting her children with their studies so that they can have good professional careers.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support of the loan they granted because thanks to it her business will start to improve much.  Her life and her family’s life will also change.

The members of the group and the activities they carry out are as follows: 

Blanca-clothing store
Francisca-milk sales
Claudia-sewing workshop
Juana-laundry 
Jonaz-grocery store
Maribel-sale of items for the home

loans.use: to buy clothes and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Pechie

texts.en:
Pechie works hard to support her family. She is married and has been selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, socks, blouses and other clothing. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Pechie would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, socks, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: Pevi

texts.en:
Pevi is 47 years old, married and has four children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Pevi requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain  her business.

In the future, Pevi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 33 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rhodora has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rhodora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and married with five children. Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a tobacco and vegetable retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the tobacco and vegetable retail business for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs and water buffalo.

Veronica aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 28,000 PHP  through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Monina has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from ice candy & fruit vending.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is recognized as an oriented person. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for a long year. She is 50 years old and blessed with two children.  Mila is married to a farmer. As of now, Mila wants to receive a loan in the amount of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

This business helps Mila because it's the only source of income she has to raise her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children ages 15 and 10. Her husband works as a window glass maker. Jocelyn works with her husband and helps manages their glass making business, which has been around for 5 years. Jocelyn works hard to improve their business and take care of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more glass and window frames. Jocelyn hopes to have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more glass and window frames.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and has three children. Rowena is married and all three children are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 31 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to stock and sell in her store.

Aileen has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Aileen aspires to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock and sell in her store.

loans.name: Saint Dominique Group

texts.fr:
Mr WENDINMANEGDE alias MOUSTAPHA est le représentant du groupe SAINT DOMINIQUE. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a 4ans et le moins âgé a 6 mois. Il a deux (02) personnes en charge.

	Mr est vendeur de sac à main et chaussures depuis 10 ans.il s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes.

	Mr MOUSTAPHA veut s’acheter 15 sacs à mains et 15 chaussures.

	Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne agrandir sa boutique et scolariser ses enfants quand ils auront l’âge d’aller à l’école.
texts.en:
Mr. Wendinmanegde AKA Moustapha is the representative of the Saint Dominique Group.  He is married and the father of two children. The oldest one is 4 years old and the youngest 6 months. He is financially responsible for two persons.

Mr. Moustapha has been a handbag and shoe seller for 10 years. He gets his supplies at the sector 10 market. His customers are women. He would like to purchase 15 handbags and 15 pairs of shoes.

He uses his profit to strengthen his activity. His ambition is to enlarge his shop and put his children in school once they will be old enough

loans.use: to purchase 15 handbags and 15 pair of shoes.

loans.name: Las Flores De Barajillas Group

texts.es:
