Este grupo se llama Las Flores de Barajillas los integrantes eligieron este nombre para este grupo, porque como son puras mujeres se consideran bellas como una flor y también porque así se llama su comunidad, ya que todos pertenecen a la misma, esta historia es acerca de la señora Juana ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 44 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo Abel estudia cursa el tercer año de preescolar, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos destazados desde hace mas de 6 años .

Ella dice que se decidió por esta actividad ya que quería buscar la manera de ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una buena educación para sus hijos, también para tener una solvencia económica estable, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de mas pollos al mayoreo, para continuar con sus ventas. 

La meta que se ha puesto doña Juana es la de darle una muy buena educación a su hijo, para que así pueda continuar estudiando y pueda tener una profesional, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que está pensando en empezar a construir un local, para poner su pollería y así tener mucho mas surtido, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ingresos.

La señora Juana está muy agradecida con FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos va a poder hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Juana son: Gloria, María Teresa, María, Esmeralda, CitlalI, Rocío, Victoria, Sarahi, Guillermina, Elizabeth, Juana y Juana Gómez, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: frutería, venta de ropa, pescados, abarrotes, venta de comida, maíz, carne, tamales, frutas y verduras, zapatos, perfumes, cosméticos y polleria.
texts.en:
This group's name, “Las Flores de Barajillas,” was selected by the members because, since they are pure women, they can be considered beautiful like flowers, and because the community they all belong to also bears that name.

This story is about Juana, one of the group members. She is 44 years old and a single mother with 6 children, of whom only Abel is in school, in the 3rd year of pre-school. All her other children are married. Juana has sold cut-up chicken for over 6 years.

Juana says that she decided on this activity while searching for a way to offer a better quality of life for her family and a good education for her children, and she wanted to enjoy more stability and economic solvency. The loan she requests will be used to buy more chickens at wholesale and continue her sales.

Juana's goal is to provide a good education for her son, so he can continue to study and have a profession. Also, she wants to make her business grow much more, since she is thinking of starting construction on her own cut-up chicken shop and thus, have a much greater selection in a shop that will improve and increase her income.

Juana is very grateful for FRAC and Kiva because, thanks to them, she will be able to expand her business and improve her family's quality of life.

Juana's companions are: Gloria, Maria Teresa, Maria, Esmeralda, Citlall, Rocio, Victoria, Sarahi, Guillermina, Elizabeth, Juana and Juana Gomez, each dedicated to different activities, including: sales of fruit and vegetables, clothing, fish, groceries, food, corn, meat, tamales, shoes, perfume, cosmetics, and chicken.

loans.use: purchase more chickens at wholesale to cut up and sell.

loans.name: Productoras Del Oriente Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Productoras del Oriente está conformado por la señora Reina David va a comprar con su préstamo pollo por mayoreo y recaudos, la señora Juana va a comprar zapatos, la señora Eulalia va a comprar harina, colorantes para elaborar obleas, la señora Leonila va a comprar gomitas, paletas, cacahuates, la señora Dolores Olivia va a comprar alimento para engordar cerdos, la señora Catalina va a comprar maíz para elaborar tortillas. La señora Eulalia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es madre soltera con 4 hijos 1 mujer y 3 varones, la niña estudia la primaria, un varón estudia la primaria y 2 varones mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella elabora obleas para su venta, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, colores, aceite, bolsas de plástico, cinta canela para elaborar obleas, ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años lo inicio por un proyecto le dieron la materia prima y 1 máquina para hacer obleas, su negocio es importante porque de ahí saca para comer, para darle a sus hijos para el desayuno y para los gastos de la escuela, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su negocio en su casa trabaja y puede atender a sus hijos, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su negocio comprar otra máquina de obleas y que sus hijos estén bien. Ella este Félix con el préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar la materia prima para seguir trabajando y producir más obleas. Las integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad, gracias a sus préstamos siguen trabajando en los negocios”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is named Productoras del Oriente.  It is made up of Reina David, who is going to buy chicken wholesale and spice mix; Juana, who is going to buy shoes; Eulalia, who is going to buy flour and coloring to make "obleas" [thin wafer sandwiches filled with caramel]; Leonila, who is going to buy gumdrops, icepops, and peanuts; Dolores Olivia, who is going to buy pig feed; and Catalina, who is going to buy corn to make tortillas.

Eulalia, 39, is a single mother with four children, one girl and three boys.  The girl and one boy are in elementary school, and the two older boys already work.  She makes obleas to sell.  She requested the loan to buy flour, sugar, coloring, oil, plastic bags, and packing tape to produce the obleas.

She began her business six years ago.  As part of a project she was given the raw materials and an oblea machine.  Her business is important because it is where she gets the money to eat, to give her children breakfast, and to pay the school expenses.  She is proud to have her business in her house.  She works and can attend to her children.

Her dreams and hopes are to expand her business, to buy another oblea machine, and for her children to be well.  She is happy about the loan she is going to receive.  She is going to buy the ingredients to continue working and making more obleas.

The members of the group are grateful to Kiva and Fundación Realidad.  Thanks to their loans they continue working in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, coloring, plastic bags, and packing tape.

loans.name: 17 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 17de septiembre lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Salvadora de 45 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos desde hace 5 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería en ropa y calzado de témpora en especial por la Semana Santa.
Las otras integrantes son Marisol por encargo y ropa usada desde 5 años y María auxiliadora de 55 años quien trabaja con Avon y ropa de encargo.
texts.en:
The “17 de Septiembre” group is made up of three hardworking women.  One of them is Salvadora, 45, who has been selling clothes and shoes for five years.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothes and footwear especially for Holy Week.

The other group members are Marisol who has sold to order and used clothes for five years and María Auxiliadora, 55, who works with Avon products and sells clothes on order.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es originaria de Granada, de 24 años de edad, soltera, madre de 1 hijo el cual tiene a su cargo, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de fritos, comidas y sopa con 4 años de experiencia en su negocio. Su actividad la inicio con la venta de fritos los fines de semana a medid que fue adquiriendo experiencia y obteniendo clientela fue metiéndose a la venta de comida y frijoles cocidos debido a la necesidad que pasaba en ese momento de obtener dinero para poder pagar sus estudios asi logro sacar su carrera siendo este su primer negocio, en el negocio es apoyada por su mama. Una de sus expectativas es lograr  acondicionar mejor su negocio.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la fritanga como plátanos, carnes, repollo, etc. Todo lo necesario para tener el negocio, el crédito le ayudara porque con buenas condiciones en su negocio le generara más ganancias para lograr mejorar su local.
texts.en:
Maria, 24, is from Granada and is a single mother with one son.  She has sold fried foods, main dishes, and soups for four years.  She started her business selling the fried items on weekends and as she gained experience and customers, she began to sell other food and beans because she needed to make more money to be able to pay for her studies. She wanted to learn about the business since this was her first try. The business  helped support her mother and one of the things that she learned was how to improve what she was doing.
She is requesting a loan to buy products for her fried foods such as plantains, meat, cabbage, etc, everything that she needs for the business.  The financing will help her to have a better set up so that she can generate more earnings to have a better stand.

loans.use: to buy products to fry such as beans, meats, cabbage, etc

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, él es pensionado,  tienen casa propia, el negocio de María es el transporte de carga, trabaja junto a su esposo e hijos, tiene 10 años de experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para el pago de la actualización de tarjeta y cambio de placas, pues con esto podrá seguir circulando en el país ofreciendo su trabajo, evitando posible multas.
La aspiración de ella es generar lo suficiente en dinero para las necesidades de la familia y poder comprarse otro camión.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband, who is a pensioner, and they own their home. Maria's business is transporting goods. She works with her husband and children and has 10 years of experience.

She is requesting this loan to pay for the vehicle registration card and license renewal. With these, she will be able to continue driving around the country offering her services and avoiding possible fines. Her goal is to make enough money to provide for her family's needs and to be able to buy another truck.

loans.use: to pay for the vehicle registration card and license renewal.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.

Edilberta requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Edilberta would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more banana to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosa Silvia

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, su esposo y tres hijos de 18, 23, 27 años de edad, los dos mayores no dependen de ella, aunque su esposo con sus ocupaciones le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, Rosa administra una tienda en la que vende productos no perecederos y también queso, este negocio lo atiende en la vivienda, desde hace 3 años, también se encarga de  distribuir quesillo y sorbete.
Ella esta solicitado un préstamo para la compra de quesillo para la reventa y también azúcar, aceite, embutidos, entre otros productos que son necesarios para seguir generando ventas.
La aspiración de Rosa es que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios, para que tengan mas oportunidades de crecimiento, con el préstamo espera tener una mayor afluencia de clientes que le demanden al negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her family, her husband and three children who are 18, 23, and 27 years old.  The two older ones no longer depend on her but her husband with his occupations sometimes helps her out with household expenses.  

Rosa runs a store where she sells non-perishables and also cheese.  The business is located at home and she’s been in business three years.  She also sells string cheese and frozen treats.

She’s asking for the loan to buy cheese to resell and also to buy oil, sugar and canned goods among other products that are needed to continue generating sales.

Rosa’s hope is that her children will complete their schooling so that they will have more growth opportunities.  With the loan she expects to have more customers who will make demands on the business.

loans.use: to buy cheese, sugar, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Villa Ingavi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA INGAVI” iniciará el decimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Virginía. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cubrecamas, herrería, venta de ropa, venta de carne, venta de medias, venta de fruta.

La señora Virginía, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal desde hace un año atrás, ingresando por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de tachos, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de tachos) mismos que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta estar en grupo para compartir.

En la fotografía no se encientra la señora Irma, ya que se fue a realizar la consultamédica.
texts.en:
The “Villa Ingavi” communal bank will start its 18th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Focal Center.  It has 8 members and they have a governing board led by Virginia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which we have sale of bedspreads, metal work, clothes sales, meat sales, stocking sales and fruit sales.

Virginia indicates that she’s been part of a communal bank for a year having been invited to join by a member.  She currently has a business selling containers; she’s had it for years.  The loan this cycle is to expand her merchandise.  She will buy containers in the city of El Alto and then resell them in street markets.  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes sharing in the group.

Irma does not appear in the photo because she had a doctor’s appointment.

loans.use: to buy containers.

loans.name: Ignacia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ignacia de 48 años de edad es originaria de Granada, casada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y granos básicos con 35 años de experiencia, madre de 4 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. Inicio su actividad ayudándole a la mama vendiendo en el mercado después la mama le dejo el negocio a ella, fue invirtiendo con créditos otorgados de otras instituciones financieras hasta lograr vender todo lo que le demanda la clientela, sus productos los comercializa en un tramo que tiene en el mercado. Recibe el apoyo del esposo que trabajo de obrero  aportando para la comida.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosa y comprar láminas de zinc para componer  su tramo, este crédito le ayudara porque podrá satisfacer las necesidades del cliente que le generara más ingresos. Sus planes futuros es poder llegar a mejorar con laminas de zinc su tramo para tener un lugar en buenas condiciones donde pueda guardar su mercadería sin necesidad de estar pagando bodega y asi comprar más productos.
texts.en:
Ignacia, 48, is from Granada.  She’s married and works as a grocery and basic grains merchant.  She has 35 years’ experience.   She’s the mother of four children who are still in her care.  

She started her activity helping her mother sell in the market and then her mother left the business to her.  She invested loans from other financial institutions managing to sell everything her customers were requesting.  She sells her products in a space set aside in the market.  Her husband works as a laborer and contributes toward food.

She’s asking for the loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and soft-drinks and also to buy metal sheeting to repair her stand.  This loan will help her because she will be able to satisfy customer demand generating more income.

Her future plans are to improve her stand with metal sheets so that she can have better conditions and be able to store her merchandise and not have to keep paying storage fees and be able to buy more products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and also to buy metal sheeting to repair her stand.

loans.name: Nubia Esperanza

texts.es: Nubia es originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante tiene el negocio de pulpería, venta de leña y frijoles cocidos, casada, madre de 3 hijos de los cuales uno esta a su cargo y dos  tienen vida independiente. Inicio su actividad con la venta de frijoles cocidos y leña después fue viendo que los vecinos le pedían que pusiera venta de productos básicos como arroz asi fue poniendo su mini pulpería con el apoyo de instituciones financieras siendo este su primer negocio. Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que su esposo comercializa electrodomésticos y ropa a los alrededores de su comunidad, ella tiene como expectativa incrementar su  negocio en productos básicos. Realiza el préstamo  para compra de productos básicos como café, aceite, arroz, bebidas y pollo, este crédito le ayudara ya que al mantener su negocio fijo le traerá mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es dejarle a sus hijos un negocio bien surtido y rentable con el que puedan sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Nubia is from Granada and is a merchant who has a grocery store where she sells wood and cooked beans. She is married and has 3 children; she is responsible for one, and the other two are independent. She began the business by selling cooked beans and firewood. Later she realized that the neighbors were requesting consumer staples like rice. So she set up her little grocery store with the support of financial institutions, as this was her first business. 

She has other income because her husband sells small appliances and clothing in the surrounding areas. She hopes to increase her stock of basic products. She will use the loan to buy consumer staples such as coffee, oil, rice, beverages, and chicken. The loan will help her maintain her business and generate more profit. Her plan for the future is to leave her children a well-stocked, profitable business that will allow them to survive.

loans.use: to buy consumer staples such as coffee, oil, rice, beverages, and chicken.

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en:
Carlosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Carlosa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Carlosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad es originario de Granada, de oficio mecánico-comerciante, casado, realizo estudio de técnico mecánico, actualmente tiene el negocio de pulpería desde hace 16 años actividad que surgió después que lo despidieron de su antiguo trabajo de mecánico en Monisa donde fue liquidado de ahí tomo la decisión de invertir ese dinero en la compra de productos básicos como azúcar, arroz, pan, etc. El cuenta con otros ingresos que salen de los trabajos esporádicos que hace en su comunidad como mecánico  dejando a cargo del negocio de pulpería a la esposa, tiene como expectativa mantenerse en crecimiento en su negocio y no necesitar de créditos.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más productos básicos como gaseosa, jugos, avena, leche, etc.  Este crédito le ayudara porque podrá mejorar sus ingresos con el objetivo de mantener siempre su capital para seguir respondiéndole a sus clientes, como planes futuros desea remodelar su casa  con el apoyo de nuestra institución. El se considera una persona que se esmera por mantener sus negocio y diversificar sus productos con mas demanda.
texts.en:
José, 53, is from Granada.  He’s a mechanic-merchant.  He’s married and studied to be a technical mechanic.  He has had a grocery store for 16 years, a business that arose when he lost his job as a mechanic in Monisa.  He used his severance pay to invest in the purchase of basic staple items like sugar, rice, bread, etc.  He relates that he can also count on additional income he earns sporadically on jobs he gets as a mechanic in the community.  When that happens, he leaves his wife in charge of the grocery store.  His goal is to continue growing in business and eventually not need any loans.

He’s asking for the loan to buy more basic staple items like soft-drinks, juice, oatmeal, milk, etc.  The loan will be helpful because he’ll improve his income with the objective of always having capital to continue responding to customers.  As future plans he hopes to remodel his house with support from our institution.  He considers himself to be a person who strives to stay in business and to diversify products most in demand.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su esposo, su hijo de 22 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como las empanadas, pasteles, yuca, ella trabaja desde hace 15 años, aprendió de su madre la elaboración de estos productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de plátanos, yuca, maíz, leña, esta compra le servirá para seguir en la producción de los antojitos, mejorando su capacidad de producción y de atender a nuevos clientes.
La aspiración de Blanca es tener mas clientela para atender, porque depende de la demanda para crecer en el negocio y mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her husband and her 22 year old son.  She has been selling snacks like “empanadas” (turnovers or pockets), pastries, and yucca for 15 years.  She learned how to make these products from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to buy bananas, yucca, corn, and firewood.  This purchase will help her to continue her snack production, improve her production capacity, and to tend to new customers.

Blanca’s goal is to have more customers to attend to because the growth of her business and the improvement of her income are dependent upon  customer demand.

loans.use: to buy bananas, yucca, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Maryuri De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maryuri es una joven de 27 años de edad originaria de Chinandega, actualmente vive en  León, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, madre de 2 hijos que tiene a su cargo. Inicio su actividad desde hace 3 años ayudándole a sus padres a la crianza de cerdos, luego decide independizarse poniendo su propio negocio con ayuda de su esposo comenzaron a la compra y venta de ganado comercializando sus productos en los alrededores de su comunidad y en departamentos con la expectativa de comprar mas ganado para venderlo a un mejor precio. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de vaquilla y los insumos necesarios para la alimentación de los animales. Este crédito le ayudara porque podrá tener mas ganado para la venta lo cual le traerá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maryuri, 27, is from Chinandega but currently lives in León.  She’s a merchant.  She buys and sells cattle.  She’s the mother of two children who are in her care.  She started her activity three years ago helping her parents raise pigs.  She then decided to become independent setting up her own business with help from her husband.  They started to buy and sell livestock selling it around their community and in the departments hoping to buy more cattle to sell at better prices.  

She is asking for the loan to buy a calf and the necessary supplies to feed the animals.  This loan will help her because she’ll have more livestock to sell which will lead to better profits.

loans.use: to buy a calf and feed.

loans.name: Juan Eulalio

texts.es:
Juan, administra un taller de enderezado y pintura, vive con su esposa, la suegra y una hija que tienen 6 años de edad, el taller de Juan tiene dos años de existir, lo aprendió en un tiempo que emigro a Estados Unidos.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el empastado y pintura, como cera, pinturas de varios colores, base, masías, para poder tener lo necesario y solventar las necesidades de los clientes, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su trabajo.
La aspiración de juan es tener un taller más amplio, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia a través del esfuerzo diario en el  trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan runs an auto body and paint shop.  He lives with his wife, mother-in-law and a six year old daughter.  Juan’s workshop has been in operation for two years.  He learned during a time he was living in the United States.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for dent repair and painting like wax, paint in various colors, base coat paint and other supplies to have everything needed to satisfy customer need.  With this loan he will be able to improve his work.

Juan’s goal is to have a bigger shop and to improve his family’s quality of life through his daily efforts at work.

loans.use: to buy wax, paint, base coat, sandpaper.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos de 26 y 28 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tacos, tamales, panes con pollo y hamburguesas, esta en este negocio desde hace 7 años, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, harina, pollo, condimentos, aceite, para la producción de la venta,   esto le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio, con materiales que son necesarios para la producción.
El objetivo de María es  tener un negocio con mas capacidad, para que se mas rentable, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudio y cubrir los gastos necesarios del hogar.
texts.en:
María lives with her family, her husband and her two children, ages 26 and 28.  She sells tacos, tamales, bread with chicken and hamburgers.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, flour, chicken, condiments, and oil to make the food that she sells.  This will help her strengthen her business with materials that are needed for the production.

María’s goal is to have a business with greater capacity in order for it to be more profitable.  She also wants this to support her children’s education and to cover the necessary household expenses.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, chicken, condiments, and oil.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married to a farmer and they raise their family in a village. They were blessed with four children and they plan to educate them and give them a better life. Due to the hardships of living, Angelina is involved in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She has been operating this business for almost three years and usually earns a profit of 7,000 PHP a month that she utilizes for their necessities and the allowances of their children. 

She plans to improve her pigpen and raise more pigs. But due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional 13,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and materials needed in hog-raising.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and materials needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
Consesa is from Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Consesa is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Consesa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Consesa been in this business for three years and earns 9,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Consesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consesa is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
Yesenia, es la presidenta del banco.
Ella y sus compañeras se interesaron en conformar un banco ,con el propósito de obtener un crédito que les permitiera desarrollar una actividad productiva, para la generación de ingresos, con los cuales ellas pueden aportar al presupuesto familiar, ofrecer productos en su comunidad y lograr independencia económica.
Las señoras viven en un pequeño pueblo de Cartago llamado Tejar y alrededores, donde no hay muchas fuentes de trabajo asalariado acordes con su nivel académico.
Todas las mujeres atienden sus tareas domésticas y sus pequeños negocios, como es el caso de Yesenia, quien tiene una pequeña actividad porcina.En la mañana como a las 6 am lava la porqueriza , alimenta los cerdos , y regresa a su casa para realizar las tareas domésticas. Al final de la tarde lava nuevamente su porqueriza y alimenta los cerdos.
Tiene como meta el poder crecer económicamente , forjar un mejor futuro para ella y su familia
El mayor obstáculo que enfrenta es el no contar con capital para ampliar su negocio. Por eso considera que el préstamo que le ofrece la fundación , es una oportunidad para lograr sus propósitos .
El grupo se conforma por la motivación que les dio una integrante que ya había participado en otro grupo, una fortaleza que ellas tienen es que se conocen desde hace varios años, porque muchas de ellas tienen un vínculo familiar fuerte.El nombre que le ponen al banco encierra el objetivo de ellas buscar un futuro mejor, con mujeres más realizadas y con aspiraciones cumplidas.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the bank president. She and her fellow members were interested in forming a bank in order to obtain a loan that would allow them to develop a productive activity to generate income to contribute toward the family budget, to offer products in their community and to attain economic independence.

The women live in a small town and its surroundings in Cartago called Tejar where there are not too many salaried jobs available according to their academic levels.  All the women tend to their household chores and to their small businesses as is Yesenia’s case who has a small pig raising business.

In the morning around 6am she washes out the pig sty, feeds the pigs and returns home to do her chores.  At the end of the afternoon she once again cleans out the pig sty and feeds the pigs.  Her goal is to grow economically and forge a better future for her and for her family.

The greatest obstacle she faces is not having enough capital to expand the business and this is why she considers the loan offered by the Fundación to be an opportunity to reach her goals.

The group formed thanks to the encouragement from a member who had already participated in another group.  One of their strengths is that they have known each other for several years since several of them share a strong family tie.  The name they gave their group envelops the goal they have of searching for a better future with more empowered women and with attained goals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Luz, vive en casa propia, tiene 3 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana(segunda mano) , lociones, calzado, tiene experiencia en el negocio, manejándolo de la mejor manera para hacerlo más productivo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos fardos de ropa y uno de calzado, con este préstamo lograra mantener en el negocio un surtido de nuevos estilos de ropa y zapatos, también le permitirá tener el dinero necesario para cancelar al momento de la entrega.
La aspiración de Luz es crecer en el negocio, montar un local donde ofrezca ropa y calzado americano.
texts.en:
Luz lives in her own house. She has 3 children. She sells American clothing (second-hand), lotions, and shoes. She has experience in the business and manages it in the best way to make it more productive.

She is requesting a loan to buy two bales of clothing and one of shoes. With this loan she will have in her business a stock of new styles of clothing and shoes. This will also allow her to have the money necessary to pay in full at time she gets the clothing.

Luz’s aspiration is to grow her business and open a store where she can sell American clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothing and one of shoes

loans.name: Loyda

texts.en:
A very diligent and hardworking person, Loyda is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy Tupperware kitchen utensils for her business. Loyda is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged-children. 

She hopes that someday she can build a stall for her business so that it is easy to display the items she can sell in the community.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware kitchen utensils for her business.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: Salvador Antonio es un emprendedor que se dedica a brindar venta de repuestos de vehículos usados, este emprendedor ya es clientes de Fundación León 2000, en los créditos otorgados anteriormente ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación, su sueño es tener el negocio bien  surtido para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento  para invertir en el negocio en la compra de caja de cambios, tablero, llantas, baterías, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Salvador Antonio is an entrepreneur who sells spare parts for used cars.  This entrepreneur is already Fundación León 2000 client.  In previous loans he showed himself to be a responsible person with a desire to improve.  His dream is to have a well-stocked business to offer his customers.  He is currently asking for financing to invest in the business buying a gear box, dashboard, tires and batteries, among other products.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Pablo Sexto Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pablo Sexto lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Beatriz quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 31 años en la cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Paulina quien vende ropa y Gressell quien vende productos Avon.
texts.en:
The “Pablo Sexto” (Paul VI) group is composed of three hardworking people.  One of them is Beatriz who has owned a grocery store for 31 years and who will invest her loan in the purchase of basic grains, etc.  

The other group members are Paulina who sells clothes and Gressell who sells Avon products.

loans.use: to purchase basic dry grains.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, es comerciante de verduras, vive en casa familiar, tiene dos hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su esposo, sus hijos son dependientes; el negocio de Evangelina es la venta de verduras frescas, lo inicio por la necesidad de aportar una ingreso a su familia, aunque originalmente inicio con la venta de ropa, pero luego se decidió por tener un puesto de verduras.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior y chancletas, para poder tener un rubro más en el negocio, volviendo poco a poco a la venta de ropa, este préstamo le ayudara para aumentar las posibilidades de obtener un porcentaje de ganancia.
La aspiración de ella es poderse construir un local seguro, donde poder ubicarse con toda la venta, donde tenga la afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
Evangelina has a small business selling vegetables. She lives in the family home and has two minor children. She lives with her husband, and their dependent children. 

Evangelina sells fresh vegetables. She started doing this because of the need to contribute income to her family. Although originally she started with clothing sales, she later decided to have a vegetable stand.

She is applying for a loan to buy underwear and sandals, in order to have one more line of merchandise in her business, returning little by little to the sale of clothing. This loan will help her increase her opportunities for getting a profit percentage.

Her ambition is to be able to construct a secure retail location for all her sales, where she will have an influx of customers

loans.use: To buy underwear and sandals.

loans.name: Simeon Ernesto

texts.es:
Simeon, vive con su familia, con sus padres y hermanos, esta soltero, en su familia todos trabajan, él se dedica a la venta de marañón, aprendió con unos amigos, compra la semilla cruda, y la procesa para ponerla a la venta, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semilla de marañón cruda, con esto estará creciendo en el negocio,  pues dispondrá de suficiente cantidad para azar y procesarla, estando preparado para las ventas.
La aspiración de él es tener un negocio bien establecido, contar con un buen numero de clientes, y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Simeon lives with his family, with his parents and siblings. He is single. Everyone in his family works. She sells cashews, which he learned to do with some friends. He buys the raw nuts and processes them for sale. He doesn’t have a set work schedule.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw cashew nuts. With this he will begin building his business. He will have a great enough quantity to toast and process so that he will be ready for sales.

His aspiration is to have a well-established business, to have a good number of clients, and to form his own family.

loans.use: to buy raw cashew nuts

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying junk materials to resell. He earns approximately USD 5 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day.
 
Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Thea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 43 years old and is from Ndunyu. He is married to Lydia. They have eight children who are all in school.

Geoffrey is a farmer and has been in this business for the past year. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy seedlings for his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand and to have much harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, se dedican a una granja de pollos de engorde, tiene un año en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia, trabajando junto a su esposa para poder tener una fuente de ingresos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pollos y concentrado, para aumentar el negocio y tener suficiente cantidad para alimentar la granja.
El objetivo de Juan es mejorar y prosperar con su familia, aumentando las utilidades que le genere la granja.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family, his wife and two children. They have a farm where they fatten chickens. He has been in this business for one year, and he started it of his own initiative, working with his wife to have a source of income. 

He is requesting a loan to buy chickens and feed so he can grow the business and have enough quanitity to feed the chickens.

Juan’s goal is to improve and prosper with his family, growing the income that the farm generates.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Camino De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Camino de Luz está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mildred Solís quien tiene 27 años quien se dedica al comercio de productos Avon, Oriflame y ropa desde hace 4 meses. Ella inicio con el negocio su mamá y actualmente ella lo administra. 
Mildred hábil quien trabajaba en una universidad de prestigio en la cual inicio como guarda luego paso hacer secretaria y termino sus estudio universitarios.
Las otras integrantes son María Magali quien tiene una fritanga y Mirella quien vende sandalias hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The group, "Camino de Luz" [Walk of Light] is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Mildred, who is 27 and has made a living selling Avon and Oriflame products and clothing for four months.  She started the business with her mother and currently she manages it.  Mildred is skilled and used to work at a prestigious university as a guard and later became a secretary and finished her university studies.  

The other members of the group are María Magali, who sells fried foods, and Mirella, who has sold sandals for five years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing and Avon and Oriflame products).

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Visitacion

texts.en:
Ma. Visitacion is 36 years old, married and the owner of a store where she sells different products to the community.  Ma. Visitacion is a very kind person and responsible to her family.  She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy additional products such as snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store. 

Ma. Visitacion hopes that her store will expand so that she can renovate her store to make it more convenient for her customers.  In this was she hopes to increase her income and with this will be able to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Sokunthea, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. 

Sokunthea's husband runs a public transportation service. He earns about USD 4 per day.  Because his present motorbike is too old; Sokunthea is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one, which will enable him to continue to run his service. This purchase will enable her husband to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run an additional business of buying rice to resell at a profit to generate extra income to support the family and help her children obtain a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to enable him to run his transport service.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  She is 57 years old.  Rosalina is married and has six children.  

To make a living, Rosalina raises livestock, particularly cows for sale.  Rosalina has been in her business for seven years and earns 8,400 PHP a month for these activities.  

In 2008, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Rosalina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell on in the future.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell on in the future.

loans.name: Etelia Marlenys

texts.es:
Etelia, vive con su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos, tamales, yuca, pasteles, este negocio lo realiza para generar ganancias para su familia, ayudándole a su esposo con algunas necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para elaborar los productos, como el maíz, aceite, yuca, condimentos, pollo, verduras, que son los que le dan vida al negocio, esta inversión le ayudara a ella para tener lo necesario y utilizarlo para la venta.
La aspiración de Etelia es tener una fuente de ingresos constante para su familia, además poder a futuro construir una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Etelia lives with her husband and three minor children. She sells snacks, tamales, yuca, and cakes. She carries out this business to generate earnings for her family, helping her husband with some household expenses. 

She is applying for a loan in order to buy ingredients for making the products, such as corn, cooking oil, yuca, condiments, chicken, and vegetables, which are the things that keep her business going. This investment will help her have what she needs, and use it for her sales. 

Etelia's ambition is to have a source of steady income for her family, and also to be able to build her own house in the future.

loans.use: To buy corn, cooking oil, yuca, condiments, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Belia

texts.es: La cliente, Belia, es una señora de 25 años de edad, está casada, como pareja ya viven juntos desde hace 7 años, la cliente se dedica  a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 12  km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, la cliente vive con su esposo, ambos tienen un hijo dependiente, el destino del crédito es para la refacción de su vivienda, (techo para tinglado para sus vacas), la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento,  es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Belia is 25 and married.  She and her husband have lived together for 7 years.  She makes a living selling raw milk.  She currently has 6 heads of dairy cattle that are producing.  She lives in the area south of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 12 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  She and her family live in their own home.  She lives with her husband and their son.  The loan will be used to make repairs to their property (to make stalls for their cattle), since it has worn out a lot over time and because of the humidity that has done damage to the lower part of the walls due to the constant rains in the city.  It is the rainy season now, and their home now needs the respective maintenance, which is why we are telling the short story of this client, so you will all know about her.

loans.use: to make repairs to her property.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su tía y un padrino,  esta soltero, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, tiene 6 años de estar en el negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos naturales como linaza, omega, aceite de bacalao, entre otras medicinas que son elaboradas con hierbas naturales, esto le ayudara para incrementar el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos de venta.
La aspiración de Juan es fortalecer mas el negocio, creciendo para estabilizar su situación de comerciante, así estará ofreciendo mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his aunt and a godfather. He is single. He sells natural medicines. He learned this business from his family. He works Monday through Saturday. He has been working in this business for 6 years. 

He is requesting a loan to buy natural products such as flax, omega, cod fish oil, and other medicines that are made with natural herbs. This will help him to grow the business and improve his income from sales.

Juan’s aspiration is to strengthen the business and grow so he can stabilize his situation as a merchant so that he can offer better conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy natural products such as flax, omega, and cod fish oil

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Hon, 44, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband are sculptors who earn approximately USD 5 per day.  Four of her children are employed in a garment factory.  They earn approximately USD 12 per day.  

In order to improve her business, Hon is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase more metal to produce more sculptural items to sell.  By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to stabilize her family’s living condition.  In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children obtain a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more metal to produce more sculptural items to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, se dedica a la venta de empanadas y tostadas, lo realiza de forma ambulante, ella vive sola con tres hijos, viven en casa propia, el negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia, uno de sus hijos mayores le ayuda a realizar la venta, tiene dos años en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de plátanos  y aceite, leche y azúcar, para poder realizar la elaboración de empanadas y tostadas, con esta inversión lograra mejorar el negocio, para salir a ofrecer a los clientes.
El objetivo de Sandra es aumentar la producción en su negocio, para tener mayores ventas, pues esto le dará una estabilidad económica más solvente.
texts.en: Sandra makes a living selling empanadas and tostadas, which she does as a traveling vendor.  She lives alone with her three children in their own home.  She started her business through her own initiative.  One of her older sons helps her sell.  She has had this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to buy plantains, oil, milk, and sugar to make empanadas and tostadas.  With this investment, she will be able to improve her business and will go out to sell to her customers.  Sandra's goal is to increase the production of her business and to make more sales.  This will give her a more reliable economic stability.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, solo el trabaja en el hogar, inicio desde muy joven con su padre que fue quien le enseño a trabajar, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar el trabajo.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para aplicarlos al cultivo, el abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, esta compra le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios y poder fortalecer la siembra.
El objetivo de Omar es que su trabajo en la tierra sea provechoso, obteniendo buena producción para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Omar is a farmer. He lives with his wife and their two children. He only works at home. He began when he was very young with his father who taught him to work. He doesn’t have set work hours. 

He is asking for a loan to buy materials to use in farming, like fertilizers, herbicides, and better seeds. This purchase will help him to have the necessary supplies and be able to boost his harvest. 

Omar’s goal is that his work with the land will be profitable, yielding good production to support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and better seeds.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Joven Julio  es soltero tiene 26  años de edad, Julio   estudia Maquinaria pesada  en un instituto de prestigio , Julio escogió esta carrera ya que es su vocación y tiene las capacidades y habilidades para desarrollarse profesionalmente, actualmente Julio  trabaja en una empresa de transporte ya que él es chofer ,su sueño de Julio es con el tiempo tener su propio carro y ayudar a sus padres,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar  matrícula y pensión  , Julio cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Julio is single and is 26 years old. He is studying Heavy Machinery in a prestigious institute. Julio chose this degree because it is his vocation and he has the capacity and ability to develop professionally. Currently Julio is working at a transportation business where he is a driver. Julio’s dream is to have his own car eventually and help his parents. With the goal of continuing to grow, he is requesting a new loan to pay for tuition and room and board. Julio will achieve his goals through much hard work and effort and the loans from Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and room and board

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, and children's outfits.

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios con Nosotros lo conformas tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Mirna de 58 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 5 años la cual inicio con la venta de ropa usada. Ella trabaja junto con su hija menor y su esposo e invertirá en mercadería.
Las otras socias son Gloria Maria quien vende de nacatamales, sopa, vaho y dulces tradicionales y Gloria del Socorro vende ropa de paca desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The group Dios con Nosotros (God with Us) is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mirna who’s 58 years old. She’s been selling clothes and shoes for 5 years, and she began by selling used clothes. She works along with her young daughter and her husband, and she will invest in merchandise. 

The other members are Gloria Maria who sells tamales, soup, steamed meat and vegetables, and traditional candy. Gloria del Socorro has been selling bulk clothing for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio surge por la necesidad de mantener una ocupación y sobre todo algo que le diera la oportunidad de ayudar a su esposo en lo económico.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de producto fresco, como conchas, camarón, pescado fresco y seco, esto le ayudara para surtir y disponer de suficiente producto fresco.
La aspiración de Reyna es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación y ejemplo de trabajo, esperando que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Reyna lives with her husband and their children. She sells seafood. This business came about due to the need to have a job and above all something that provides the opportunity to help her husband with money. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fresh product like conches, shrimp, and dried and fresh fish. This will help her supply and have enough fresh product. 

Reyna’s dream is to be able to give her children a good education and work example, hoping that they can be successful.

loans.use: to buy conches, shrimp, and dried and fresh fish.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and is married to Benjamin. They live in the village of Nagrumbuan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Remedios raises hogs in order to acquire an income and to lift her family out of poverty. Remedios usually raises hogs to fatten and breed. She has been doing this for two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP for each hog sold. 

Remedios wants to improve her hog-selling business and is in need of additional capital so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability. 

In the future, she would like to make her small business stronger and continuously acquire profits from it.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a food vendor from Talibon, Bohol. She is 38 years old and is a married woman with five children with ages between 3 months and 17 years old. Alma's husband works as a driver.

Alma has been a food vendor for five years. She sells "banana cue" (on a stick) and "camote" (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes and pancakes. She earns 2000 PHP per month with this business. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas. Alma hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil and bananas

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en:
Mylene Faith is 26 years old, married, and has one child. She is from San Juan Panaon, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Mylene Faith plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Mylene Faith been two years in her business. 

In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mylene Faith is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 53-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 10 years. Wilfredo earns about 10,000 PHP per month from fishing. He is able to provide for his family's daily needs with his income. 

Wilfredo works hard to improve the standard of living of his family. He requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights. Wilfredo hopes for this loan to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and lead weights

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is a 50-year-old resident of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She provides for her seven children's needs from the little amount of 3,000 PHP she earns monthly from her own piggery business, which she has run for five years as an aid to the income earned by her husband. Since 2009 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 5,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Virginia wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn, 52, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over twenty years and is successful in her career. Additionally, she sells Khmer traditional medicine (herbal medicine) to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about USD 8 per day. 

Due to difficulty with the family’s economy, Roeurn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved  on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amor y Paz lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elisa quien desde hace 1 año vende frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados más grandes y populosos de Managua. Ella está casada con don Luis quien es comerciante y con quien tiene un hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en cosechas de aguacate.
Las otras integrantes son Martha quien vende leche y leña por flete desde hace 15 años en el mercado local junto con su esposo, Rebeca comercializa frutas, maní y lea, el maní empacado lo vende a las pulperías y Yesica vende tortillas, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The "Amor y Paz" [love and peace] group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising women. Elisa is one of the members and for one year she has been selling fruits and vegetables in one of the biggest and most populous markets in Managua. She is married to Luis who is a salesman and together they have one son. She will invest the loan in avocado crops. 

The other members are Martha, who has been selling milk and wood from her cart in the local market for 15 years, working with her husband. Rebeca sells fruits, peanuts and wood. She sells the packaged peanuts to local stores. Yesica sells tortillas, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase crops of avocados.

loans.name: Flores Ometepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre flores Ometepec las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque es el apellido de la persona que formo el grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora clara ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella tiene 57 años de edad y es viuda desde hace mas de 8 años tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo miguel estudia cursa cuarto año en el tecnológico, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de piñatas desde hace mas de 1 año.

Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios y darle una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le deja muy buenas ganancias, el crédito que recibió lo va invertir en la compra de material como son: papel, pegamento, cartón, globos, papel metálico, ollas, yeso, laminas, etc. 

La meta que se ha puesto doña clara es la de ofrecerle una excelente calidad de vida a su hijo ya que también, quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, tanto que está pensando en ampliar su local para poner una dulcería y así tener mucho más surtido y con más variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Doña Clara le da las gracias a Fundación realidad y kiva  por la ayuda que le están brindando, ya que podrá mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia, también ahora gozaran de una solvencia económica más estable.

Las integrantes del grupo flores Ometepec y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: dolores-dulcería, clara-venta de piñatas y Alberto-abarrotes
texts.en:
This group is called Flores Ometepec, the people comprising this group decided to name it after the surname of the person who founded the group. 

This story is about Clara as she is this group's representative. She is 57 years old and has been a widow for more than 8 years. She has 3 children, of which only Miguel is in his 4th year of studies in technology at university. Clara has been making and selling piñatas for more than 1 year.

She says that she decided to set up this business because, aside from the fact that this activity returns good profits, she wanted to find a way to support her son with his studies and give him a better quality of life. The loan which she has received will be invested in the purchase of material such as: paper, glue, cardboard, balloons, foil, ceramic pots, plaster, sheets, etc. 

The aim which Clara has given herself is to provide her son with an excellent quality of life and she also wants to grow her business much more, so much so that she is thinking of expanding her business to set up a section for sweets and thereby have a larger stock and a greater variety of products to improve and increase her profit margins. 

Clara thanks the Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the help which they are giving her, as she will be able to improve her quality of life as well as that of her family, in addition, they now enjoy a more stable financial situation.

The members of the Flores Ometepec group, and the activities they pursue are as follows: Dolores (sweet shop), Clara (sale of piñatas) and Alberto (groceries).

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of material such as: paper, glue, cardboard, balloons, foil, ceramic pots, plaster, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Santos Elvira

texts.es: La señora Santos Elvira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Masaya. Ella desde hace 8 años quien se dedica al comercio de carne negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de carne de res y cerdo...etc. su meta es tener una gran carnicería.
texts.en: Santos Elvira is a hard-working and enterprising woman from Masaya. For 8 years she has been selling meat. She will invest her loan in this business to purchase beef and pork among other items. Her goal is to have a large butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. To make a living, her spouse has been operating a motorcycle transport service for the people in their village for over 10 years now, earning about P7,500 each month. This income goes mainly toward the children's school expenses.

Felicitas would like to make improvements on their services and so is requesting a loan of P14,000 to buy crude oil, tires and gasoline for maintenance of the motorcycle. In the future, Felicitas would like to achieve a stable source of income so her family can achieve financial stablility.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, tires and gasoline for maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Alonso

texts.es:
El señor Alonso José es trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica al comercio de huevo desde hace un año en Jinotepe. El invertirá el crédito en la compra de cajillas de  huevo aproximadamente 36 cajillas. 
Le es casado y tiene tres hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente junto a su esposa. Su meta es tener un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Alonso José is hard-working and enterprising. For one year he has been working selling eggs in Jinotepe. He will invest the loan to purchase approximately 36 cases of eggs.

He is married and has three children for whom he works very hard with his wife. His goal is to have a large business.

loans.use: to purchase cases of eggs.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en: Ma. Leonora is a 37-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is in the business of pottery making. She has had this business for eight years and earns about 5000 PHP per month. She requested a loan to buy more clay and painting supplies. Ma. Leonora is hoping to have a better income that would enable her to sustain her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy more clay and painting supplies

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 27 years old. She has been running a retail food business for three years. Regine has requested the loan to buy more sugar, cooking oil and flour to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the same business. In the future, Regine wants to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil and flour to sell.

loans.name: Marisue

texts.en:
Marisue lives at Cataggaman with her spouse and three children. To make a living, her spouse provides daily motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. This way, the family earns about P8,000 each month and has just enough for meals, electric bills, and school expenses of their children. 

Marisue would like to make improvements on their business so that their income will increase, too. She would like to ask for a loan of P8,000 to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. She would like to ensure safe travel for the passengers and for her husband's life as well. 
Marisue is also praying for good health and a happy family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a sari-sari store owner from Talibon, Bohol, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children between the ages of 1 month and 13 years. Erlinda, who sells various items including shampoo, vinegar, soy sauce and snacks, works hard to earn better and support her family.

She is now requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, snacks and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store soon. Erlinda also dreams of being a successful businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, snacks and canned goods.

loans.name: San Agustin Chacalapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama san Agustín chacalapa decidieron nombrarlo así porque este es el nombre del santo que festejan en su comunidad, y chacalapa es el nombre del lugar donde viven, esta historia es acerca de Juana ya que pertenece a este grupo, ella cuenta con 37 años de edad y está casada con el señor Raymundo quien es campesino, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo Rodolfo, juliana y Joaquín estudian, cursa primer y tercer año de prepa, el menor primer año de secundaria, ya que el más pequeño apenas tiene 3 años de edad y el mayor está casado, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva más de 5 años.

Comenta que decidió poner esta tienda porque su localidad es muy pequeña y no hay mas negocios de este tipo, aparte de que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos ya que deja buenas ganancias, con el préstamo que recibió piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercancía para surtir bien su negocio como: refrescos, sopas, jabón, aceite, fríjol, arroz, azúcar y sal, ya que es lo que mas vende.

Ella dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas de su comunidad, ya que antes de que ella abriera su tienda de abarrotes las personas tenían que ir al pueblo vecino por los productos que nesecitaban, pero ahora ya no tienen que salir tan lejos y se ahorran tiempo y dinero. 

La meta que tiene doña Juana es la de hacer crecer más su tienda ya que quiere ampliarla un poco más, para tener una extensa variedad de productos para así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una buena profesión y un muy buen futuro.

Le da las gracias a los prestatarios y a kiva por la confianza que le están dando a ella y a su grupo, ya que con su apoyo están pudiendo sacar adelante sus negocios y mas que nada a sus familias que son las que más necesitan esta ayuda.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de san Agustín chacalapa son las siguientes: Inés, ysaura, Juana, Guadalupe, Ignacia y daría, de dedican a la venta de abarrotes, refrescos, comida, carnes y pollos.
texts.en:
This group is called San Agustín Chacalapa, they decided to give it this name because it is the name of the patron saint of their community and Chacalapa is the name of the place in which they live. 

This story is about Juana who is a member of this group. She is 37 years old and is married to Raymundo who is a farmer. They have five children of which only Rodolfo, Juliana and Joaquín are studying as the youngest in the family is only 3 years old and the oldest is married. The three studying are in 1st year of university, 3rd year of high school, and the youngest is in the 1st year of secondary school.

Juana has a grocery store which she has been running for more than five years. She says that she decided to set up this store because, aside from the fact that it is a very good source of income as it returns good profits, her town is very small and there are no businesses of this type. With the loan that she has received, she is planning on investing in the purchase of more goods to stock her business well, such as soft drinks, soups, soap, oil, beans, rice, sugar and salt as these are what sell the most.

She says that her business is benefiting many people in her community, given that before she opened her grocery store, people had to go to the neighboring town for the products they needed, but now they don't need to go as far, saving them time and money. 

Juana's aim is to make her store grow as she wants to extend it a bit more in order to have a wider variety of products to be able to continue supporting her children with their studies so that they can have get a god job and a have very bright future. 

She thanks those who lent the money and to Kiva for the confidence they are placing in her and her group, as with their support, they are able to spur on their businesses and, above all, their families who are the ones who are most in need of this help.

The people comprising the San Agustín Chacalapa group are the following: Inés, Ysaura, Juana, Guadalupe, Ignacia and Daría, who make their living selling groceries, soft drinks, food, meat and chicken.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her business such as soft drinks, soups, soap, oil, beans, rice, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Amparo es una mujer luchadora, casada con una familia de tres hijos ya todos independientes ella continua dedicandose a la venta de ropa y comesticos por catologo, empezando con ahorros propios pero luego con micro-creditos que fueron ayudandandole a que el inventario de su negocio aumentara. Hoy en dia cuenta con el apoyo de su tres hijos y de su señor esposo quien es guarda de seguridad, sin embargo asegura ser de las personas que nunca le ha gustado depender de nadie por lo que siempre le ha gustado mantener su propio dinero y de esa manera sastifacer todas sus necesidades basicas. En esta ocasión el mayor proyecto que tiene es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda asi su familia tendra proteccion y seguridad. Con el prestamo comprara materiales de construccion que ayudaran a cambiar el nivel de paredes de su hogar y el entechado del mismo. Agradece el apoyo de la micro-financiera por el apoyo a mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Amparo is a determined woman. She is married, and has a family of three children, all of whom are now independent. She continues to work selling clothing and cosmetics by catalog. She started with her own savings, but later with microloans that gradually helped her increase her business's inventory. 

Nowadays, she has the support of her three children and of her husband, who is a security guard. However, she asserts that she is one of those people who have never liked to depend on anyone, so that she has always liked to earn her own money, and that way satisfy all her basic needs.  

On this occasion, the greatest project she has is improving her home's infrastructure, so that her family will have protection and safety. With the loan, she will buy construction materials that will help her change the level of the walls of her house, and improve the roofing also. She is grateful for the help of the microfinance institution; for their support in improving her standard of living and the condition of her house.

loans.use: To raise the level of the walls, and improve the roofing on her house.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
At age 39, Rosemarie has already been blessed with three children. All attend school. All she wants is to provide them a good education and employment someday. Rosemarie and her spouse untiringly generate income for the family. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village while she raises hogs to sell. 

Rosemarie would like to provide maintenance for their motorcycle unit so that her sposue will continously provide safe travel for the passengers. In this matter, she is now asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy new pairs of tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. In the future, Rosemarie would like to improve their earnings for the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy new pairs of tires and crude oil for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 30, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over six years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Lay is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. This money will help her acquire the security to start the business and generate more income to support the family. In the future she would like to build a new house and help her child get a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, aged 35 years, runs a retail business which she has been running for the past four years. She wants the loan to buy rice, sugar, salt and cooking oil. With the profits, Rose plans to reinvest in the business. In the picture, Rose was at the parking lot of the bank.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Moise De Nagrin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ASSETOU est la représentante du groupe MOÏSE DE NAGRIN. Elle est mariée sans enfants. Elle a deux (02) personnes en charge.

	Mme est restauratrice depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques et au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont ses amis, voisins, marchands et autres.

	Mme veut s’acheter un (01) sac de riz, un (01) bidon d’huile et du cube maggi.

	Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour investir dans son activité, épargner et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Elle ambitionne agrandir son restaurant et réaliser d’autres projets.
texts.en:
Mrs. ASSETOU is the representative of the group MOÏSE DE NAGRIN. She is married without children, but she does have two dependents in her care. She has been running a restaurant for three years. She buys her supplies from local shops and at the big market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are friends, neighbors, merchants and others.

Mrs. Assetou wants to buy one bag of rice, one jug of oil, and some Maggi bouillon cubes.

She uses her profits to re-invest in her activity, to increase her savings, and to help cover the household expenses. In the long run, she plans to expand her business and tackle other projects.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice, one jug of oil, and some Maggi bouillon cubes.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico tiene 62 años de edad,  es casado y tiene 5 hijos de 32, 28, 26, 20 y 17 años de edad, vive en  Villanueva, Cortes.
Don Federico hace 12 años se dedica a reparar bicicletas y vender repuestos dela misma. El inicio este negocio por la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a solventar las necesidades de su familia. Manifiesta que este negocio demanda muchos clientes y por lo tanto le va muy bien.  Su negocio ha crecido favorablemente y lo mantiene estable gracias a la buena administración y los financiamientos que ODEF le ha proporcionado.
El lleva varios prestamos con ODEF, en la actualidad solicita otro de 14,000 lempiras para comprar repuestos para bicicletas. Con esta inversión el solventara las necesidades de los clientes en cuanto al servicio.
Su meta en la vida es seguir creciendo en su negocio para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Federico is 62 years old.  He is married, and has five children aged 32, 28, 26, 20 and 17.  He lives in Villanueva, in Cortes.

For the last twelve years, Don Federico has worked repairing bicycles and selling bicycle spare parts.  He began this business out of the need to look for a source of income which would help him to meet his family's needs.  He demonstrates that this business has many customers, and therefore it is going very well for him.  His business has grown well, and he keeps it stable thanks to good management and the loans that ODEF has provided to him.

He has taken several loans through ODEF, and is currently requesting another one for 14,000 lempiras.  This is for purchasing bicycle spare parts.  With this investment, he will be able to meet his customers' service needs.
