His goal in life is to continue growing his business so that his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo el buen progreso está conformado por tres integrantes trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Blanca quien se dedica al comercio de cosechas especialmente de tamarindo desde hace 8 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito. 
Las otras integrantes son Olga de la Cruz quien se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 15 años y a realiza nacatamales, frito, chicharrón, moronga cabeza de chancho, y vende el hueso y la carne, y Miriam del Carmen quien vende cosméticos desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The group El Buen Progreso (Good Progress) is made up of three hardworking and enterprising members. One of them is Blanca who has been working selling produce, especially tamarind, for 8 years. She will invest the loan into this business. 

The other members are Olgo de la Cruz who has been butchering pigs for 15 years. She makes tamales, fried pork rind, and pork head blood sausage, and she sells the meat and bones. Miriam del Carmen has been selling cosmetics for 2 years.

loans.use: to buy tamarind.

loans.name: Nji

texts.en:
This borrower is married with two children and they live in Alankie, a district in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  The main challenges he has faced are sickness in his family, no adequate finances to pay for his children's schooling, unemployment, accident and rampant death in his family and he hates thinking about these things.

He has taken out and repaid loans ten times and says if given the new loan requested he will buy more piglets, feed and construct a pig sty, and also use some of the money for farming purposes. He is very positive the business will succeed because the demand for pigs is high in his neighborhood, many occasions are celebrated with the consumption of pig meat and also he supplies food crops in his district and neighboring districts. He says with this business the community will benefit from manure which will be used for crop fertility, and he will provide employment to the community since he will hire people to work in his farm.

He promise that the profit from the loan will be used for his children's education, feeding his family, expansion of his pig farm, and employment of more workers. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because training is given before loan disbursement and also, they give loans to the poor at low interest rates with installment payment.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and construct a pig sty.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Madame Anta est entrée dans le commerce il y a de cela 6 mois seulement. Elle vend des habits prêt à porter pour femme. Elle est âgée de  29 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle a ouvert  une cantine  au marché. Avec  le crédit elle va acheter  des body, des jeans, des chemises, des habits prêts à porter. 
Anta n’a pas de charges et travaille pour diversifier ses produits et services. Elle a comme souhait  d’ouvrir une autre cantine pour augmenter  son bénéfice.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anta started working in small trade only six months ago. She sells ready-to-wear ladies apparel. She is 29 years old and married with children. 

She runs a small shop at the market, and she plans to use her loan to buy bodysuits, jeans, shirts, and ready-to-wear ensembles.

Anta has no expenses. She works to diversify her products and services, and her goal is to open another shop to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear ladies apparel for resale.

loans.name: Nelyn Sagrario

texts.es:
Nelyn tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 2 años de edad tres de ellos están estudiando, vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula.
Neylin tiene un negocio de pulpería. Hace 2 años lo estableció con la intención de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y con la ayuda de su mama quien fue la que le proporciono las facilidades para establecerlo. Vende productos alimenticios de primera necesidad como, harina, manteca, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, verduras y refrescos.  Ella ya cuenta con su clientela y los atiende desde muy temprano dándoles un buen servicio.
Este es su segundo Préstamo con ODEF de 9,000 lempiras y lo necesita para comprar y surtir su negocio de productos como carnes, lácteos, granos básicos y refrescos. Para seguir vendiendo los productos que generan mayor demanda.
Su meta es seguir proporcionándoles a sus hijos la educación, y poder verlos graduarse hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Nelyn is 25 years old.  She is married, and has four children aged 11, 9, 7 and 2; three of whom are in school.  She lives in Chamelecón in San Pedro Sula.

Neylin has a convenience store business.  She established it two years ago with the intention of helping out her husband with the household expenses, and with the help of her mom who provided her with the means to set it up.  She sells everyday food products such as flour, butter, rice, beans, sugar, meat, dairy products, vegetables, and sodas.  She already has a customer base, and she tends to them from very early in the morning, providing them with good service.

This is her second loan with ODEF, and is for 9,000 lempiras.  She needs it to purchase products to stock up her business, such as meat, dairy products, basic grains, and sodas, so that she can continue to sell the products that generate the most demand.

Her goal is to continue providing her children with an education, and to be able to see them graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as basic grains, meat, dairy products and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años, se dedica a la venta de fruta al por mayor, poco a poco Modesta ve como sus ahorros están creciendo, y esta haciendo planes para invertirlos, su mayor anhelo que es sus hijos sean profesionales. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo destinará para la compra de fruta por mayor.
texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the "Nueva Vida" ["New Life"] communal bank.  She is 50 years old and works selling fruit at wholesale.  Bit by bit, Modesta has seen how her savings have been growing, and she is now making plans to invest them.  Her biggest desire is for her children to become professionals.

The loan that she is now requesting will be allocated for the purchase of fruit at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is from Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 31 years old. Violita is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store and she also makes and sells baskets made of "lagpakanay". She has been in her business for four years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2011, Violita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy more stock to sell and to buy more "lagpakanay" used in making baskets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell and to buy more "lagpakanay" used in making baskets

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a thirty-one-year-old married woman. She keeps fish and grows mushrooms and has been in the business for seven years now, getting a monthly income of KES 20,000. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more mushroom plants. In future she wants to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more mushroom plants

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a responsible mother of two children who aims to become successful in the future. She is 43 years old and married to Rolando. She is engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband to generate income to satisfy their family's needs. She has been in this business for almost seven years and usually earns profits of PHP 8,000 for every two pigs she sells.

Rosalia planned to acquire more pigs to raise but she didn't have enough capital, therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve her business and she hopes that she will make her business grow in future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is aged 27. She is married to a businessman and they have one child aged 2. She has requested the loan to add more merchandise like sugar, rice and utensils to her shop which she has been running for the past three years. With the profits she plans to make more investments in the same business.

loans.use: To add more items to her shop such as sugar, rice, and utensils for sale.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en: Razel, a 31-year-old single mom with one child, lives in Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Razel used her last loan to purchase additional goods to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store

loans.name: Zachie

texts.en: Zachie is 31 years old. She has been running a ladies' clothes shop. With the loan she will add more skirts and blouses for sale. She has been planning to use the profits to reinvest in the same business. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 37 years old and single. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET  LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase clothes for resale in her business.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase  more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 39 years old. She married to an electrician and they have four children who all attend school. She sells fabrics as she has been doing for the past 8 years. With the loan, Consolee will buy more fabrics to sell. She has the idea of paying school fees from the profits she will obtain from the business. She has a big vision for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is responsible mother who is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is 50 years old and has two children. Elma is married to Robert. At her age, Elma still works hard to give her children a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for over five years and has extensive experience in this business.

Elma dreams of lifting her children from poverty, and she wants also to provide the necessities for her hogs, thus she wants to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and provide higher prices when it is time for them to be sold.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en:
Perpetual is 38 years old. She is a single mother of two. She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past 11 years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of shirts to sell in her business.

She hopes to own permanent premises to run her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shirts to sell.

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали житель района Вахш. Ему 58 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Курбонали строитель, в этой области он работает 30 лет. Кроме того он занимается скотоводством у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Qurbonali lives in the Vakhsh Region. He is 58 years old. He is married and has children. Qurbonali is a construction worker; he has been in this line of work for 30 years. In addition, he raises livestock by his home. He has been in this business for 16 years. He is taking out a loan in order to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita, tiene 63 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace más de 10 años, aprendió sobre la responsabilidad y como progresar en su negocio gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal, también ha mejorado las relaciones en su hogar. El préstamo que esta solicitando ahora lo invertirá en un recreo (restaurante campestre) que está abriendo.
texts.en: Berta is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank.  She is 63 years old and makes a living selling food.  She has 2 children, and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 10 years.  Berta has learned a lot about responsibility and how to move forward with her business thanks to the training she has received at her communal bank.  Her relations with members of her household have also improved.  Berta plans to use the loan to invest in a ‘recreo’ (country restaurant) that she is opening.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for setting up her restaurant.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 50 years old and has 7 children. She is married and 2 of her children are in school.

Edina is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Edina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 41 years old. She is a widow with two children, ages 6 and 16, and both attend school. She owns a butcher shop which she has been running for the past eight years. She is requesting the loan to buy more meat to sell. With the profits she plans to pay rental charges and to pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура проживает в районе Бохтар. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Мастура занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает национальные платья. Мастура сама вместе с дочерью шьет национальные платья для продажи. В этой области она более 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Mastura lives in the Bohtar Region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Mastura works as a vendor at the market. She mainly sells traditional national dresses. Mastura herself, together with her daughter, sews traditional clothing for sale. She has been in this business for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy cloth.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa, 48 years old, is a married woman with six children (three children who are in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Generosa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

Generosa requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell. In the future, Generosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de plantas, es madre de 4 hijos y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace más de 10 años, gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal ha aprendido sobre el ahorro y como educar a su familia, también aprendió sobre la responsabilidad y la puntualidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá comprando plantas de Huancayo para venderlos en Huamanga.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank.  She is 42 years old and makes a living selling plants.  She has 4 children and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 10 years.  Juana has learned about saving and how to educate her family thanks to the training she has received at her communal bank.  She has also learned to be responsible and punctual.  Juana will use the loan to purchase plants in the province of Huancayo, which she will then sell in her home province of Huamanga.

loans.use: to purchase plants to sell.

loans.name: Fátima Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, casada y con dos niños. Ella es docente desde hace varios años, además comercializa ropa y prendas de oro y plata desde hace varios años de manera ambulante y con ayuda de su hermano lleva mercadería Costa Rica. 
Ella invertirá en  pantalones, camisas y blusas en especial por la temporada.
texts.en:
Fátima is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She is married and has two children.

She has been a teacher for several years.  She has also been selling clothes and gold and silver jewelry for several years.  She sells in an itinerant manner, and with her brother's help she also transports merchandise across the Costa Rican border.

She will use the loan to buy pants, shirts, and blouses especially for the season.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Angelita Maritza

texts.es: La señora Angelita mujer esforzada y resposable con la educacion de sus hijos; desde hace un tiempo que Angelita tiene como oficio el ser Agente de Loteria, negocio que ha sido el sosten para ella poder sacar adelante a su familia. Para la ampliacion y mejora a su vivienda, recurre al financiamiento ofrecido por Afodenic que hasta el dia de hoy asegura la señora ser despues de Dios el principal medio para ella poder ver realizado uno de sus grandes sueños como lo es la construccion de su casa. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara materiales de construccion para la realizacion del muro de la parte trasera ya que con el que cuenta por ahora su vivienda es con la pared de su vecino a su vez realizara la instalacion de tuberias de aguas fluviales en su hogar. Su plan a futuro es seguir haciendole mejoras a su vivienda y de a esta manera ofrecerle a los suyos mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Angelita is a hard-working woman who is responsible for educating her children. For a while now, Angelita has been working as a Lottery Agent, a business which has been the means of support for her to get her family ahead. 

In order to extend and improve her home, she has sought financing from Afodenic which, after God, she maintains has been to date the main means of her achieving one of her most cherished dreams, that of building her home. 

Today, with this new loan she will buy construction materials to build the wall at the back of her home, as the wall she currently has belongs to her neighbor, at the same time, she will install pipes for river water in her home. Her long-term plan is to continue making improvements to her home, and that way offer her children better security.

loans.use: to buy a wall and install pipes for river water in her home.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Pascual le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso en toda la casa, solicita un préstamo para comprar el vitropiso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Pascual es empleado de una fábrica desde hace más de cuatro años, como jefe de producción, este es el ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia y con el cual planean pagar ese crédito. 
Con este préstamo su hogar se ver mas cómodo y será mas higiénico para sus hijos y los podrá proteger de enfermedades. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y que el patrimonio de su familia este en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
In Pascual's home, floor tiling is lacking throughout the house. He is requesting a loan to buy the tile and pay a person who will carry out the improvement.  

Pascual has been an employee in a factory for more than four years, working as chief of production. This is the income he has to provide the best for his family, and with which he plans to pay off this loan. 
 
With this loan, his home will become more comfortable and will be more hygienic for his children, so he will be able to protect them from diseases. 

His desire is to improve his family's quality of life and the condition of their property.

loans.use: to buy and install floor tiles.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been selling music discs and movies in Nakuru town for the last four years. He is 29 years old and married to Everline, and they are blessed with three children. Patrick was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients. This will be his first loan. 

Patrick plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of music discs for sale in his business, hence serve his clients well and meet their demands. 

In the future, Patrick hopes to expand his business and make more income, thereby improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more stock of music discs.

loans.name: Damas De Exito Group

texts.es:
El grupo damas de éxito está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras un de ellas es Sara Judith quien se dedica a la realización y venta de repostería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 20 años con pequeñas cantidades de espumilla, maní, churritos, cajeta de leche, majar…etc. los cuales comercializa de manera ambulantes las ciudades aledañas.
Las otras integrantes son Juana quien vende ropa usada y María quien comercializa cosméticos desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The Damas de éxito (Women of Success) group is made up of three hard-working business women, one of whom is Sara Judith who makes her living making and selling confectionery. She started this business 20 years ago with small amounts of meringue, peanuts, churritos (fritters), milk candies, manjar (caramelized condensed milk) and so on, which she sells as a street vendor in neighboring towns.

The other members of the group are Juana, who sells second-hand clothes, and María, who has been selling cosmetics for three years.

loans.use: to make meringues, peanuts, fritters, milk candies, caramelized condensed milk, etc.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 25 years old and is single. He sells cows and fertilizer; he has been in this business for one year. Pierre currently employs one person to help him.

Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more cows and fertilizer to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more cows and fertilizer to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

Gemma has a seaweeds culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her seaweeds culture business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her seaweeds culture.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Margie works hard to support her family.

Margie has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fruits retail.  Margie is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additonal materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is now borrowing PHP 18,000 to fund her fishing/fish vending business. This business was previously funded through NWTF/KIVA. The loan has continued to provide Jessica and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Adriana del Socorro quien se dedica a la costura. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo don Anibal quien es sastre en su taller de costura desde hace 18años. 
El crédito lo invertirá en  tela, hilos, zier…etc. para realizar pantalones blusa y camisas entre otras cosas.
Los otros integrantes son María de la concepción quien vende lo derivado del maíz como nacatamales tamal, yoltamal atol, elote cocido…etc. Y José Mario quien vende  cosechas y leñas desde hace 21 años.
texts.en:
The group Nuevo Horizonte (New Horizon) is made up of 3 hardworking and enterprising members. One of them is Adriana del Socorro who is a seamstress. She works together with her husband, don Anibal, who’s been a tailor in a sewing shop for 18 years.  

She will invest the loan into fabric, thread, zippers, etc to make pants, blouses, and shirts among other things. 

The other members are María de la Concepción who sells corn products like Nicaraguan tamales, sweet spiced tamales, and cooked corn. José Mario has been selling produce and wool for 21 years.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Maryury Del Carmen

texts.es: Maryuri Del Carmen es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual la emprendedora nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento ha aumentado su inversión de igual manera sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos como blúmer, camisas, pantalones, toallas, entre otros productos que más demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Maryuri Del Carmen is an entrepreneur who works with Fundación León 2000.  She says that she has managed to increase her investment along with her number of customers thanks to the funding she has received.  She is currently seeking a loan so she can invest in her business.  She plans to purchase products such as underwear, shirts, pants, towels, and other items that are most in demand among her customers.

loans.use: to purchase underwear, shirts, pants, towels, and other products that are high in demand.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es:
Inocenta es una mujer de 48 años de edad,  de estado civil soltera, con 2 hijos mayores de edad.  Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y  sus hijos en el distrito de La Victoria, en la provincia de Chiclayo. La zona donde vive es rural (caserío) cuenta con agua potable y luz eléctrica.
Inocenta se dedica a la crianza de animales, actividad que realiza en la parte posterior de su domicilio, en corrales adaptados. Tiene más de 19 años de experiencia en este rubro. Inocenta también trabaja preparando chicha para los restaurantes.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se destinarán a la construcción de su vivienda y mejoras en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inocenta is 48 years old, single, and has 2 grown children. She lives in her own house with her partner and her children in the district of La Victoria in Chiclayo province. The area where she lives is rural (village). She has potable water and electricity.

Inocenta raises animals in adapted corrals in the back part of her home. She has been doing this work for more than 19 years. Inocente also works making chicha (a beverage made from corn) for restaurants.

The loan amount requested is 1000 nuevos soles, which will be used for the construction of her house and improvements to her quality of life.

loans.use: to build her house

loans.name: Chan Hon

texts.en: Chan Hon, 25, is married and resides with his wife in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a motorbike washing shop and selling water for over two years, earning approximately 12 USD per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about 3 USD per day. In order to improve his business, Chan Hon is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a small tanker to carry water to sell. This purchase will help him provide faster water supply to his customers and earn more profit. In the future, he would like to expand his business and rebuild his present house to make it more comfortable for his family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a tanker to carry water to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old, married and has four children who are in school. Marites is in an agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. She has been raising cows for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Marites requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise and feeds. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and feeds

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 21 old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and has three children. Margie has a motorcycle transport business and earns 3,000.00 PHP each month from doing this type of work. She's had 5 years in this business. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance. Margie has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a responsible mother of three children. She is married to Arnold, a farmer in the village of Nagrumbuan. To make a living, Anita is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns about PHP 7,000 every time she sells in the market. 

As of now, Anita is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs. She believes that her patience and sacrifices will rewarded with good income someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is married and has 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Medina is 29 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Medina has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

Medina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Medina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more umbrellas, plastic shoes, toilette paper, soap etc. to sell.

loans.name: John Kinyua

texts.en:
John is 29 years old. He is married to Faith and together they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his third term loan. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

In the future, John hopes to practice farming in a more profitable way, such as by using technology to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting.

loans.name: Lady Mae

texts.en:
Lady Mae is 33 years old and married with two children.  With all her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lady Mae runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lady Mae would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock of items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Leslie requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Leslie hopes to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married and has two children who currently go to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, snack foods, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 32 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Gideon has been working hard to manage his small business selling clothes. 

To help expand his business, Gideon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Gideon to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Gideon hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business even more. 

Gideon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gideon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is from Tinago, Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Marjorie is married and has one child. To make a living, Marjorie opened an eatery/carenderia. She has had this business for two years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Marjorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marjorie is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her carenderia. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the carenderia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install protection on the windows and doors

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

Nenita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more meat for resale, and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Joseph hopes that, in the future, he will be able to build a small shop for selling meat. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh est tailleur depuis 8 ans. IL a ouvert un atelier au marché. IL est marié et père de famille. Il sollicite l’appui de l’IMCEC pour acheter une machine gros fil. Avec la mode actuelle, elle veut satisfaire la clientèle pour qu’elle n’aille pas ailleurs.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et travaille à améliorer les produits et services. Dans l’avenir, il voudrait ouvrir un autre atelier avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en: Mr. Cheikh has been a tailor for eight years. He has opened a tailor shop at the marketplace. He is married with children. He is seeking financial support of IMCEC in order to buy a thick-thread sewing machine.  [He] would like to adapt to the current fashion demands to ensure that his customers don’t go elsewhere. He provides for the everyday expenses of his family and works hard to improve his products and services. In the future, he would like to open a second shop, with lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy a thick-thread sewing machine for use in his shop.

loans.name: El Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Cielo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Karla Vanessa quien tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 3 años e invertirá el crédito en la compra de tintes, permanentes, cosméticos y pinturas de uñas.
Los otros integrantes son Benicia quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 20 años y Elvin quien vende espejos desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
El Cielo Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Karla Vanessa, who has had a beauty salon for three years.  She will invest the loan in buying dyes, permanents, cosmetics, and nail polish.

The other members are Benicia, who has had a grocery store for 20 years, and Elyn, who has sold mirrors for 10 years.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents, cosmetics, and nail polish.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro desea seguir cultivando, por eso solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en semilla, abono, herbicidas y preparación del terreno, haciéndole más fácil su tarea agrícola.
El ha tenido un efecto positivo en los cultivos anteriores, esto debido a la buena inversión realizada y la utilización de los recursos, el numero en su familia se mantienen igual,pero han tenido una mejor solvencia economica.
texts.en:
Pedro wants to keep farming, and for that reason he has asked for a new loan to invest in seeds, compost, herbicides and land preparation. This will make is farming easier.

He has improved his previous crops thanks to the investment he made and the use of those resources. His family size has not changed but they have more capable of meeting their financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and herbicides and to prepare his land

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El señor Abelardo esta solicitando un préstamo para terminar la barda alrededor de su casa. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es, arena, varilla, cemento y block. 
Don Abelardo es empleado de una gasolinerita como despachador desde hace más de nueve años, y su esposa la señora Martha se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus dos hijos ya adolecentes, quienes están estudiando la secundaria y preparatoria.
Con esta mejorar tendrán mayor seguridad en su casa y el patrimonio de sus hijos estará en mejores condiciones y así mejoran la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Abelardo is requesting a loan to finish the wall around his house because he does not have the necessary money to buy the materials, which are sand, rods, cement, and concrete blocks.

Abelardo has been an employee of a small gas station as a dispatcher for more than nine years.  His wife, Martha, works taking care of their two adolescent children, who are in high school.

With this improvement they will have greater security in their house and the inheritance of their children will be in better condition.  In this way they improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to finish the wall around his house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón es un hombre de 64 años de edad, no tiene carga familiar. Vive en casa familiar. La cual está ubicada en CP Tongorrape en el distrito de Motupe.  Simón vive en la parte rural de este distrito.
La actividad que desarrolla Simón es la cría y comercio de cuyes y pavos. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de su padre contando con experiencia basta en el rubro en el que se desempeña. Cuentan con clientes  ya establecidos en la zona debido a su trabajo y labor en el crecimiento de los animales.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles, y su destino será el incremento de su capital de trabajo como compra de alimento balanceado, para que de esa manera pueda tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que Simón cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.
texts.en:
Simón, 64, does not have any children in his care and lives in his family's home in a rural area of Tongorrape in the district of Motupe. Simón raises and sells guinea pigs and turkeys. He has been doing this for 15 years out of his home. He learned from his father who had a lot of experience in this field. He has established customers in the region thanks to his work at raising his animals.

The 1000 nuevos soles requested will be used to increase his business capital, like buying balanced feed. This way he will have more income for his home and will be able to improve his quality of life. There isn't any big competition in the zone in this line of work because Simón has already established his clientele.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa mística lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es Luis Alberto quien vende prendas de oro desde hace 8 años. Él está casado con doña Francisca con quien tiene 4 hijos e invertirá el crédito en mercadería. 
La señora Jovana del Socorro vende comida desde hace 4 años y Catalina tiene una venta.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mística group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  The coordinator of the group is Luis Alberto, who has sold gold jewelry for eight years.  He is married to Francisca, with whom he has four children.  He will invest the loan in merchandise.

Jovana del Socorro has sold food for four years and Catalina has a store.

loans.use: to buy jewelry merchandise.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a 45-year-old married woman with 6 children between the ages of 4 and 19. Her husband works as a baker.

Andrea has had a sari-sari store (convenience store) business for 6 months. She sells items like sugar, coffee, spices and soft drinks. She works hard to help send her children to school and make improvements on their house. Andrea is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as cooking oil, soap, shampoo and soft drinks. Andrea hopes for her business to grow so that she can achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as cooking oil, soap, shampoo and soft drinks.

loans.name: Vizminda

texts.en:
Vizminda lives in Pantaon, Ozamiz City in the Philippines. She is 32 years old, married and has 6 children. For the past 6 years, Vizminda has planted, harvested and sold bananas to make a living. She earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Vizminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a new loan of 37,128 PHP to buy young seeds to plant and fertilizer to increase farm production. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy young seeds to plant and fertilizer to increase farm production.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es: Don Jose E. soltero de 57 años de edad posee una pulperia desde hace ocho años aproximadamente en su propia casa de habitacion. Inicia su negocio de pulpero con inciativa propia y con ahorros que el venia obteniendo desde muchos años atrás. Siendo uno de sus principal objetivo el llevar a cabo la construccion de su cuarto y mejorar pequeños detalles interiores de su vivienda reccurre a la micro-financiera para gozar de este primer ciclo de credito, con el cual obtendra mayor comodidad para el y una oportunidad de financiamiento que a futuro podra destinarla tambien para el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el prestamo comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, piedrin, hierro, bloques, ceramica, perlines, laminas de zin entre otros. El señor manifiesta sentirse muy contento ya que esta infraestructura le traera a su hogar mejores condiciones de vida y a su vez  ayudara al bienestar de sus familiares.
texts.en:
José E., a 57-year-old single man, has had a grocery store in his own house for approximately eight years.  He started his grocery business on his own initiative, with savings he had been getting for many years.

He is turning to the micro-financer to take advantage of this first loan cycle because one of his main objectives is to build a room and improve some small details inside his house.  With this he will get greater comfort for himself and a financing opportunity that, in the future, he might also dedicate to the growth of his business.

He will buy the following construction materials with the loan: cement, sand, gravel, iron, concrete blocks, tiles, support beams, and corrugated metal sheeting, among others.

He says he is very happy because this infrastructure will bring better living conditions to his household and, at the same time, help the well-being of his family members.

loans.use: to build a room and to make interior improvements to his home.

loans.name: Pura Vida Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pura Vida está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es María margarita quien vende frutas y verduras desde hace 6 años en el mercado local. El crédito lo invertirá en aguacate y frutas de temporada.
Los otros integrantes son Yamileth y Javier quienes también comercializan frutas y verduras desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
The "Pura Vida" ["Pure Life"] group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is María Margarita, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last six years in the local market.  She will invest her loan in avocado and seasonal fruits.

The other members are Yamileth and Javier, who also have been selling fruits and vegetables for the last several years.

loans.use: to purchase avocado from harvest.

loans.name: C 1266 Nzamura Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 8 and 16, and also takes care of 8 relatives. She sells maize, cooking oil, salt, cassava flour, biscuits, etc. Jacqueline is a leader of the group "C 1266 NZAMURA" which in English means "LIFT UP". She is the second person from the right. 

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more maize, cooking oil, salt, cassava flour, biscuits, etc. to sell. With her profits she will be able to save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, cooking oil, salt, cassava flour, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: Jose T. jefe de familia y padre de cuatro hermosos hijos quienes aun se encuentran en la etapa de escolaridad; estudiando en uno de los colegios de nuestra capital Managua. Por ahora continua administrando su propio taxi que ha sido desde hace once años aproximadamente su principal medio para el brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos y su señora esposa. Manifiesta el señor quien labora en turnos irregulares que a pesar de las dificultades encontradas en su oficio como lo es el alza de la gasolina, la mayor demanda que crece dia a dia por contar otras personas con su propio taxi entre otras. Sus ingresos no son los mejores para el cubrir totalmente las necesidades basicas de su hogar. Sin embargo siendo este su septimo ciclo de credito agradece a la micro-financiera y a kiva por su incondicional apoyo y por ayudar a mejorar el nivel de vida de los suyos. Este nuevo credito lo ocupara para la construccion de un cuarto mediante del cual obtendra mayor privacidad dentro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose T. is the head of his family and the father of four gorgeous children who are still school-age; they attend one of the high schools in Managua, our capital city.

For now, Jose continues to drive his own taxi, which he has been doing for approximately the last eleven years.  This is his main way of providing the best for his children and for his wife.  The Señor works irregular shifts, in spite of the difficulties that occur in his line of business such as the increase in cost of gasoline, and the daily increase in other people having their own taxis, among other things.

His income isn't sufficient to cover fully the basic necessities of his household.  However, this is his seventh lending cycle, and he thanks the micro-lender and Kiva for their unconditional support and for helping improve the standard of living for his family.

This new loan will be used for the construction of a room, which will allow more privacy in his home.

loans.use: to construct a room in his home.

loans.name: Yahaira

texts.es:
Yahaira es una microempresaria joven, nicaraguense , que migró a Costa Rica siendo muy pequeña.Trabaja junto con su madre confeccionando prendas de vestir y maquilando prendas para empresas, logrando consolidar una clientela que todos los meses les genera ingresos, por el servicio que ella les  ofrece.
Su taller está ubicado en su casa de habitación en Montes de Oca, barrio Betania.Provincia de San José.
Ella todos los días se levanta temprano , trabaja en el taller de 6 am a 11 am, luego se va para la universidad hasta las 5pm y depende del trabajo que tenga que entregar termina a las 11pm en su taller.
Su meta es terminar su carrera universitaria y poder ampliar el negocio, mejorando las instalaciones para ofrecer mayor privacidad a la clientela y tener mejores condiciones de espacio.
Este crédito le permitirá comprar una máquina plana insdustrial , para poder agilizar su proceso de producción , al incrementar las piezas producidas. 
El taller no quiere dejarlo porque le ha permitido a ella y  a su  familia mejorar sus condiciones de vida, al poder comprar su vivienda, pago de estudios de sus dos hermanas menores.Pero ella considera que con apoyo económico pueden lograr dichos planes.
texts.en:
Yahaira is a young micro-entrepreneur. She is Nicaraguan, and emigrated to Costa Rica when she was very young.  She works with her mother sewing clothing, and making clothing items for businesses.  She has been able to establish a client-base who generate income for her throughout the year, because of the service that she provides them.  Her workshop is located in her home, in Montes de Oca, in the Betania neighborhood.  This is in the San José province.

Every day, Yahaira gets up early and works in the workshop from 6 a.m. until 11 a.m.  Afterwards, she goes to the university until 5 p.m., and depending on the work she has to complete, she spends up to 11 p.m. in her workshop.

Her goal is to complete her university degree and to be able to expand her business, improving her facilities so that she can offer improved privacy to her customers, and have better space.

This loan will allow her to purchase an industrial sewing machine, which will speed up her production process and increase the number of pieces produced.  She does not want to leave the workshop, because it has permitted her and her family to improve their living conditions, and she wants to be able to buy a home, and pay for the the education of her two younger sisters.  She thinks that with financial support, they will be able to achieve these plans.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Yacquelyn Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yacquelyn,  se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere comprar más materiales de cocina para realizar su venta de comida y además de mariscos. Ella comprara aceite, condimentos, carnes, vegetales, pescado, camarones.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo como el préstamo anterior realizando buenas compras y administrando bien para mejorar la situación económica de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Yacquelyn has decided to request a new loan because she wants to buy more cooking supplies to make the food and seafood that she sells.  She will buy oil, condiments, meat, vegetables, fish, and shrimp.  She has seen a positive efffect with her previous loan and made good purchases and managed them well to improve her and her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, meat, vegetables, fish, and shrimp.

loans.name: Luis Leoncio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 59 años de edad, es de estado civil soltero.Vive en casa de padres sin carga familiar directa.Luis vive en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Lambayeque. Su domicilio cuenta con servicios de agua. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Luis Leoncio es la crianza y comercialización de animales, labor que realiza desde hace 10 años.  Paralelamente Leoncio mantiene un cultivo de arroz el cual espera cosechar y vender en el mercado local. El destino del crédito será para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para su cultivo de arroz, el resto del cultivo sera destinado para la compra de animales.Él cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de labores agrícolas.
El monto solicitado en préstamo es de 1000 nuevos soles, y Luis espera que con la cosecha de su cultivo de arroz pueda ponerlo como inicial para la compra de una moto taxi y así poder trasladarse mas rápido a su chacra.
texts.en:
Luis is 59 and single.  He lives in his parents' home and doesn't have any direct dependents.  He lives on the urban edge of the district of Lambayeque.  His home has running water.  The place where he lives is a small community with approximately 100 families.  Luis Leoncio raises and sells animals, which he has done for 10 years.  He also grows rice, which he hopes to harvest and sell at the local market.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his rice crop.  The rest of his crop will go towards the purchase of animals.  He has additional income, which is a product of his agricultural work.

The requested amount of the loan is 1,000 PEN.  Luis hopes that with the harvest of his rice crop, he will be able to use it as an initial investment to buy a motorcycle so he can get to his farmland more quickly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is sixty-eight years old and married with three children. She owns a dairy farm in Emali, Kenya. She has been in the business for five years now and earns a monthly income of five thousand Shillings. 

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase cow feed. With the profits, she will purchase another cow. In the future, she plans to buy five dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase cow feed.

loans.name: Milagro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedora una de ella es Juana Esperanza quien elabora nacatamales y leña desde hace 7 años. Ella está casada con Alejandro quien es agricultor y con quien tiene un hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en leña.
Las otras integrantes son María Nela quien vende frijoles desde hace 5 año y agricultura y María de los Ángeles  vende ropa.
texts.en: The group Miracle is formed of 3 hardworking and driven members. One of them is Juana Esperanza who has been making nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetable paste cooked in banana or maize leaves) and firewood for 7 years. She is married to Alejandro who is an agricultural worker and they have one son. She will use the loan to buy firewood. The other members are María Nela, who has been selling beans for 5 years as well having worked in agriculture, and María de los Ángeles who sells clothes.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de 27 años de edad, es conviviente y con 02 hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el caserío Huaca Blanca del distrito de Tambogrande. Rubén vive en la parte rural  de este distrito y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Rubén es la crianza de animales menores como ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral, teniendo actualmente 12 cabezas, 25 patos y 04 porcinos, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Esta actividad la desarrolla hace 03 años. 
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en hacer mejoras en los corrales donde su ganado se cría y también para la compra de alimentos para su ganado ovino. De esta manera, hace crecer a los animales en mejores condiciones y resultan más vistosos a los comerciantes, los cuales al ver el buen estado de los animales, los compran sin pensarlo, generando jugosas ganancias para Rubén.
texts.en: Rubén is 27, lives in a common-law marriage, and has 2 children as his dependents.  He lives in his own home, which is located in the town of Huaca Blanca in the district of Tambogrande.  Rubén lives in the rural part of this district and only has basic electricity in his home.  He makes a living by raising small animals like sheep, pigs, and poultry.  He currently has 12 sheep, 25 ducks, and 4 pigs.  When they reach the ideal size and weight, he will sell them at the local market.  He has done this work for 3 years.  The amount of the requested loan is 1,000 PEN, which he will invest in making improvements to the corrals where he raises his livestock.  He will also buy feed for his sheep.  In this way, his animals will grow in better conditions and will look better to the merchants.  When they see the good condition of the animals, they buy them without thinking about it, which will generate good profits for Rubén.

loans.use: to make improvements to his livestock corrals.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening cattle. Additionally, they produce palm sugar to sell in order to generate more income to support the family. They earn approximately 6 USD per day. Sopheap's children are also employed as sanitation and garment workers. They earn about 9 USD per day. 

Sopheap wants to rebuild her current house. With this goal in mind, she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase timber to rebuild her house. This money will help her finish her house’s construction. In the future, Sopheap would like to expand her business by purchasing palm sugar to resell.

loans.use: to purchase timber to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
José necesita realizar una compra de madera por eso solicita este préstamo que le permita obtener los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de muebles como lo es la madera de cedro, laurel y aceituno que le ayudaran a que su carpintería tenga mayor capacidad.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio ayudándole a trabajar de una mejor manera con los clientes.
texts.en: José needs to buy wood which is why he is requesting a loan. He will be able to buy materials needed to make furniture of cedar, luarel, and olive trees. This will allow him to offer better carpentry work. He shares that the previous loan contributed to making his work better for working with his clients.

loans.use: cedar, laurel, and olive wood.

loans.name: Yorlene Lina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, La señora Yorlene, se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 4 años, es soltera sin hijos, solo a sus padres es que le ayuda.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Yorlene  atraviesa, es la compra de maíz ya que también ejerce con su papa un negocio de compra y venta de granos con 3 años de tenerlo, siendo los clientes los productores mismos de la zona, ya que su papa es un productor también, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de lo antes mencionado, y de esa manera fortalecer su inventario y nivel de venta y poder mejorar sus condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
In the city of Telica in the department of León, señora Yorlene works as an elementary school teacher at a small school in the city.  She has done this work for 4 years.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  She only has her parents, whom she helps.

One thing that Yorlene needs is to buy corn.  She does also runs a business with her father where they buy and sell grains.  They have had this business for 3 years.  Their customers are the producers in the area, and her father is also a producer.  This is why she has decided to come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy corn.  In this way, she will strengthen her inventory and level of sales to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 40 quintals of corn to later sell.

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Elba es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una pulpería. Este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años aproximadamente el cual gracias a los creditos ha ido creciendo.
El crédito que solicita es autoestima  el cual está destinado para que las clientas lo utilicen para su uso personal principalmente para el autocuido. Ella invertirá el crédito en medicamentos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elba is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman who owns a local store. She began this business approximately 2 years ago and thanks to the loans it has been growing. 
The loan requested is for personal medical expenses specifically for client's self-care. She will use the loan to buy medication.

loans.use: buy medications

loans.name: Gladys Del Pilar

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente y sus hijos, la casa está ubicada en el caserío Manco Capac en el distrito de Tambogrande. Gladys vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Gladys es el negocio de bodega y venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, el cual se encuentra en su propio domicilio, atendiendo permanentemente. Presenta clientela ya establecida en la zona y muy buen nivel de inventarios gracias a su esfuerzo y su dedicación en el desarrollo de sus actividades. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene parcela en la cual tiene mango en producción y tiene trabajo estable en una empresa agrícola n el caserío de Chapaira.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales se utilizarán para la adquisición de mercadería (productos de belleza, cremas, perfumes) directamente desde la ciudad de Sullana, para comercializarlos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gladys is 34, lives in a common-law marriage, and has 3 children in her care.  She lives in her own home with her common-law husband and her children.  Her house is located in the town of Manco Capac in the district of Tambogrande.  Gladys lives in the rural part of the district, but she has electricity in her home.  She makes a living through her business of a small grocery store and also sells beauty products through a catalog.  Her store is located in her home, where she always attends to it.  Her customer base is already established in the area, and she has a very good level of inventory thanks to her effort and dedication to her businesses.  Her husband works in agriculture.  He has a plot of land where he grows mango.  He also has a stable job at an agricultural company in the town of Chapaira.

The amount of the requested loan is 3,000 PEN, which will be used to acquire merchandise (beauty products, creams, perfumes) directly from the city of Sullana.  She will sell it to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda se a decidido por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de carne de res ya que este es el negocio que le genera las utilidades para la alimentación de su familia, revendiendo el producto.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en el negocio dándole los recursos necesarios para mantenerse en sus ventas y los ingresos de la familia, pues compro carne para mantener en el negocio.
texts.en:
Erlinda has decided on a new loan to buy beef.  This is the business that gives her the profits to feed her family, by reselling the product.

She considers that the previous loan had a positive effect on her business.  Buying the meat to support her business gave her the necessary resources to support herself in her sales and the family income.

loans.use: to buy beef for resale.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El señor José Alberto es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en especial piñas y productos de temporada. El comercializa desde hace 8 años en el mercado local e invertirá el crédito en piña.
José está casado con Luz Marina con la que tiene 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Señor José Alberto is a hard-working and enterprising man who works selling fruit: in particular, pineapples and seasonal products.  He has been selling fruit for the last eight years in his local market, and will invest his loan in pineapples.

José is married to Luz Marina, with whom he has five children.

loans.use: to buy pineapples.

loans.name: Microempresa Familiar Group

texts.es:
Vilma, de 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos  entre 8 a 12 años de edad, y vive en una aldea del municipio de Jutiapa, Atlántida.
Hace año y medio que ella estableció su propio negocio, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: granos básicos, carnes,  refrescos y abarrotería en general. Además vende comida y golosinas junto con su madre en una cafetería de la escuela de la comunidad donde recibe otros ingresos. 
Ella ha mantenido surtida la pulpería mediante préstamos, lo que ha permitido aumentar los ingresos. Actualmente está solicitando el sexto préstamo para comprar más productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería y para comprar insumos para la elaboración de comida en la cafetería.
Su plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio.
Pertenece a un grupo solidario que se llama Microempresa Familiar, compuesto por tres miembros, Vilma se identifica en la foto con blusa rayada en medio, a la izquierda esta doña Rosa quien se dedica a vender mercadería y a la derecha está Luis Omar quien se dedica a la cría  y venta de cerdos y  todos viven en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
Vilma, aged 30, is a single mother of three children aged between 8 and 12.  She lives in a village in the municipality of Jutiapa, in Atlántida.

A year and a half ago, she established her own business where she sells everyday grocery products, such as basic grains, meat, sodas, and grocery products in general.  She also sells food and candy with her mother at a school cafeteria in the community, from which she receives additional income.

Vilma has kept her convenience store stocked by means of loans, which have permitted her to increase her income.  She is currently requesting her sixth loan to purchase more food products to stock up her convenience store, and to purchase ingredients for making the food in the cafeteria.

Her plan is to continue growing her business.

She belongs to a group called "Microempresa Familiar" ["Family Micro-Business"], which is made up of three members.  Vilma can be identified in the middle of the photo by her striped blouse.  On the left is Doña Rosa who works selling merchandise, and on the right is Luis Omar, who works raising and selling pigs.  They all live in the same community.

loans.use: to stock up her convenience store business with food products, such as basic grains, meat, sodas, etc., and also to buy ingredients for making food for sale.

loans.name: Ever Antonio

texts.es:
Ever, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues el necesita comprar más materiales para el taller como hierro, pintura, electrodos, que son los materiales necesarios para elaborar los trabajos de los clientes.
Ever manifiesta haber tenido un buen servicio por parte de la institución, que le ha dado un crecimiento y mayor capacidad de respuesta para atender a los clientes, sus ingresos familiares ahora son mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Ever has decided to take out a new loan because he needs to buy more materials for his workshop, such as iron, paint, and electrodes, which are the materials needed to fill his customers' orders.

Ever has received good service from the institution, which has allowed him to grow and given him a greater ability to respond to his customers' needs.  His family's finances are now much better.

loans.use: to buy iron, paint, and electrodes

loans.name: Seily Ivonett

texts.es:
Seily Ivonett es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una comideria desde hace 10 años. Este negocio lo inicio con poco y por medio de los prestamos fue creciendo actualmente cuenta con 9 trabajadores y su meta es tener un restaurante.
El crédito invertirá en ampliación del negocio principalmente en exhibidores y productos.
texts.en:
Seily Ivonett is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman. She has had an eatery for 10 years. She started with little and through loans has been able to grow. Currently she has 9 employees and her goal is to have a restaurant.

The loan will be used to increase the business primarily through display cases and products.

loans.use: to buy shelves and ingredients (basic grains, meat, etc)

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer emprendedora, con tres hijos; todos ya mayores de edad, muy feliz por seguir con su negocio de ventas de tortillas, refrescos  cuajada y frijoles cosidos, siendo pues este su principal fuente de ingreso. Al contar con el apoyo de su menor hija de 25 años de edad señala la señora que ha podido aumentar en sus ventas y por ende en su numero de clientela. Lo que se proyecta con este nuevo credito es poderlo invertir en su negocio de manera que pueda comprar los siguientes productos: once sacos de maseca, cuatro quintales de frijoles, cinco de azucar, cuarenta libras de queso  y lo que reste en frutas, logrando con el prestamo el crecimiento de su negocio e ir incrementado sus ventas hasta el punto de que sus clientes puedan siempre tener la preferencia hacia su negocio por ofrecerle una gama de productos basicos que se consumen a diario en nuestro bello pais.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an enterprising woman with three children, all of age.  She is very happy to continue with her business selling tortillas, sodas, "cuajada" [milk curd], and cooked beans.  This is her main source of income.  She points out that with the help of her 25-year-old daughter she has been able to increase her sales and, consequently, the number of customers.

What she is aiming for with this new loan is to be able to invest it in her business to buy the following products: 11 bags of Maseca-brand masa mix, 4 quintals of beans, 5 quintals of sugar, 40 pounds of cheese, and what remains on fruit.

With the loan she will achieve the growth of her business and her sales, to the point that her customers will always prefer her business because it offers them a range of basic products that are consumed every day in our beautiful country.

loans.use: to make various purchases for her business.

loans.name: Modesta Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Lareynaga Malpaisillo Poblado del  departamento de león, la señora Modesta es  Casada comerciante, con 2 hijos  en edad escolar además es maestra de primaria en un colegio de la misma localidad, y  sus hijos a los que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, son también los que ayudan con el negocio con la ayuda de la empleada,  como es la pulpería la que tiene 13 años de ejercerla con éxito,
Desde que inicio su negocio la señora Modesta siempre lo lleva de manera paralela con buenos resultados para  poder mantener su núcleo familiar, ya que es su segundo matrimonio siendo viuda  anteriormente una de las necesidades es de comprar productos para la pulpería como: Arroz, Azúcar, aceite, frijol Jabones, pastas Alimenticias , Shampoo etc. por eso visito ceprodel para ser beneficiada con financiamiento, para seguir comercializando y satisfacer la demanda y obtener más ingresos y poder seguir ayudando al estudio de los hijos
texts.en:
Modesta lives in the municipality of Lareynaga Malpasillo Poblado in the department of León.  She is a married shopkeeper with two school-age children.  She is also an elementary school teacher at a local school.  Her children, whose education she is responsible for, are also the ones who, along with her employee, help with her business, which is a small grocery store that she has successfully run for 13 years.

Since starting her business, Modesta has always run it in such a way that she can take care of her nuclear family, as this is her second marriage after being widowed.  One thing she needs is to buy products for her small grocery store, such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, soaps, pastas, shampoo, etc.  That's why she went to CEPRODEL to receive financing in order to stay in business and satisfy the demand and make more money and be able to keep helping her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, flour, different kinds of pasta, soaps, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José continua con su granja y desea tener una nueva oportunidad para crecer comprando 300 pollos y cerdos pequeños para la venta además comprara concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos que le ayuden a prevenir cualquier enfermedad.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior se le permitió crecer y tener más trabajo mejorando las circunstancias familiares y ofrecerles una mejor condición en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Jose continues running his farm and wants a new opportunity to grow by purchasing 300 chickens and piglets to sell. He will also buy food pellets and vitamins for the chickens to prevent diseases.

He says that the previous loan allowed him to grow and have more work, improving his family's circumstances and giving them a better living conditions today.

loans.use: to buy pigs and 300 chickens, food pellets and vitamins.

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Gloria desea comprar y surtir el negocio de frutas y verduras adquiriendo un pedido del que podemos mencionar papas, cebollas, güisquiles, manzanas, uvas, fresas; esto le ayudara para que sus clientes encuentren lo necesario para el consumo.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo realizando la inversión necesaria manejando bien los fondos y ayudando más que todo a su familia de una manera más constante en aquellas necesidades más urgentes.
texts.en:
Gloria wants to buy for and stock her fruit and vegetable business by getting an order that would include potatoes, onions, chayote, apples, grapes, and strawberries.  This will help her so that her customers will be able to find what they need.

Her first loan had positive results, as she made the necessary investment and managed her funds well.  More than anything, it helped her family in a more consistent way with their urgent needs.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, chayote, apples, grapes, and strawberries

loans.name: Rahuman

texts.en:
Rahuman is 48 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 15 years, Rahuman has been working hard to manage his butchery shop where he sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Rahuman has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more meat for resale and will help Rahuman to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Rahuman hopes that in the future he will be able to have a better standard of living. 

Rahuman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rahuman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina es una mujer de 52 años, es una mujer de estado civil conviviente y no tiene hijos como carga familiar. Vive en casa propia junto a su conviviente, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío CP-12 en el distrito de Tambogrande. Rufina vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, y sólo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica dentro de su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Rufina es la venta de productos de primer necesidad, tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras, en una bodega, la cual esta en una parte de la sala de su domicilio. Además  cuenta con buen nivel de inventarios para su negocio. Adicionalmente, Rufina se dedica a la crianza de animales en su domicilio. Su esposo la ayuda en las labores pues trabaja en el ambiente agrícola.
El monto solicitado por Rufina es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados en la compra de mercadería para surtir bodega, productos como leche, huevos, útiles de aseo, etc. para así seguir creciendo en su negocio y llevar una mejor calidad de vida junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Rufina is a 52-year-old woman; she is a woman in a domestic partnership and she doesn't have children as a family responsibility.  She lives in her own home with her partner, which is located in the CP-12 neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande,  Rufina lives in the rural part of this district and she only has electricity inside her home.

Rufina's business is selling essential items, such as rice, sugar, milk, and vegetables, in a small grocery store that is in part of her living room.  She also has good inventory levels for her business.  Futhermore, Rufina raises animals in her home.  Her partner helps her with the work, as he works in farming.

Rufina has asked for 1,000 nuevos soles, which will be used to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store with products such as milk, eggs, bathroom products, etc. to keep growing her business and lead a better quality of life with her partner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store (milk, eggs, etc.)

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Regina has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, and school supplies.
