Her business is being a saleswoman, an activity that began when a friend of hers gave her merchandise on consignment, and she could return what she didn't sell. That is how she built up her initial clientele, and with her savings she was able to get together some capital and start making her own orders. She feels very content because she is independent and manages her own money.

Her goal is to increase her business and have a well stocked inventory with everything her clientele needs. But her biggest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet demand and the competition achieves a greater impact. This is precisely the reason that she has turned to her credikiva, the first financing she has done with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy women's suits, shirts, and jeans. These are what her clients have asked for, since Mother's Day is coming up, and she is ready to satisfy them so that they can give their gifts to the marvelous being that is the mother, or to whoever occupies that role.

loans.use: to buy women's suits, shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Ok

texts.en:
Ok, 58 years old, has been a hardworking farmer for almost 30 years with much experience. Despite her hardships, Ok aims to improve her rice farming business to support her only child. She wants to him to earn a degree from a university and learn enough skills to work in some type of well-paid job.

Ok is asking for additional capital to buy a motorcycle to meet her needs and better her condition. She said that to have motorcycle for household use will make is much easier to get anywhere at any time without paying transportation fees as in the previous time.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old from Nakuru and is married to Christine. They have three children. 

Joseph is a tailor and has been in this business for the past 12 years. 

He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy more materials for making dresses so as to be able to serve his clients well.

He hopes to diversify into shoe selling in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married lady who is 27 years old and blessed with four children between 2 and 7 years old.

She owns a cereals store and has been in operation for two years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan and she intends to use the amount to purchase 15 bags of dry maize and three bags of dry beans.  

The profits will be plowed back into the business and used to repay the loan. She hopes to prosper in business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 50-year-old woman. She is single with four children.

She has a livestock farming business in Zambezi. She has been in the business for 32 years now.

This will be Margaret’s second loan with KADET Ltd. She plans use the entire loan to purchase one-day-old chicks. She plans to plow the profit that she will get back into the business.

loans.use: To buy one-day-old chicks.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, composées de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zambougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, du lait et divers articles de boutique.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente MADJAN, troisième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 15 kilos de céréales avec les revendeurs sur place pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de céréales.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya Group are wives and widows, are on average 48 years old, have five children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of Zambougou, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative province in the Republic of Mali).  They know eachother along kinship lines, as neighbors and friends.  They sell grain, condiments, milk, and various household items.

The women of the Danaya Group are on their second group loan.  

Madjan, the client standing third from the left, intends to purchase 15 kg of grain from the retailers nearby in order to resell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She plans to make a monthly profit of 7000 FCFA which she will use for the needs of her family and to reinvest in her grain business.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a married man. He has two children and one is enrolled in school. His wife works as a business woman. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Yasin operates a water selling kiosk. He has worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are neighbors. Yasin's other source of income is his wife's earnings. 

He describes his greatest business challenges as high transportation costs and poor transport infrastructure. His highest monthly expense is school fees. 

Yasin will use the KES 50,000 loan to expand the business by buying pipes. Yasin aspires to be self-dependent and make more profits in the future. He joined Yehu to get financial advancements.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying pipes.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de friandises.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente DOUNAMBA, personne au milieu dans le rang des assis, compte acheter 20 kilos de mil pour la préparation du beignet avec les revendeurs pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de préparation de beignet.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo Group are wives and widows, are on average 42 years old, have three children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of N’Tjifina in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative province of Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They sell spices and sweets. 

The women of the Djekafo Group are on their third group loan.

Dounamba, seated in the middle, intends to purchase 20 kg of flour from retailers to make beignets to sell in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn average monthly profits of 10,000 FCFA which she will use to tend to the needs of her family and reinvest in her beignet-making business.

loans.use: to purchase grain.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, trabaja como artesano fabricando canaletas (son hechas de aluminio y sirven para colocarlas en las cornisas de los techos para recibir el agua de las lluvias y bajarlas a través de tubos de aluminio hasta los desagues de las casas) las cuales las vende independientemente y a contratos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de planchas de aluminio para fabricar mas canaletas y así obtener mejores ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Carlos, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carlos works as an artisan making gutters (these are made from aluminum and are used in the cornices of the roof to collect rainwater and bring it down through aluminum tubes to the house's drains).  He sells these on his own and through contracts.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of aluminum sheets for making more gutters, and so earning more income to support his family.

Carlos is married and has four children with whom he lives in anticretic housing [where the tenant pays a fixed sum at the beginning rather than monthly rental] in the Las Lomas area of La Paz city.

This is his third time working with IMPRO and his second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum sheets for making gutters.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris, trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada ofreciendo seguros de vida.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que la época de colegio ha comenzado y este es un gasto extra para el cual no tiene dinero ahorrado, pues sus ingresos no son muy altos.
Doris, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa alquilada en la zona Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Doris works as an employee for a private business that sells life insurance.

The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of school supplies for her children, as the school year has begun and this is an extra cost for which she doesn't have any money saved as her income is not very high.

Doris is divorced and has two children with whom she lives in a rented home in the Achachicala neighborhood of La Paz city.

This is her second time working with IMPRO, and her first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Srorn is married and has four children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. 

Srorn is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this along with her spouse for ages. 

Srorn has requested a first loan through HKL to purchase a motorcycle for use in the family. 

In the future, Srorn is determed to continually support her children until they graduate high school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for use in the family.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Peter has been working hard to manage his wholesale shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has three children.

He operates a transportation business in Emali. He has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 2,000 KES.

This will be Daniel’s first loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to service his vehicle, buy spare parts and pay for his license. 

With the profit that he will get he wants to educate his children and repair his car. In the future he wants to own a bigger vehicle.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a married lady, age 24, and her child is 5 years old. 

She owns a retail shop and has been in operation for four years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., and she intends to purchase sugar, wheat flour, necklaces, scissors, maize flour, cooking oil, and washing soaps and detergents for sale. The profits will be plowed back into the business and also used to repay the loan.

She hopes to expand in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, necklace , scissors, maize flour, cooking oil, and washing soaps and detergents, for sale.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is a 44-year-old divorced woman who lives with her three children in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Two of her children go to college. She started essential goods retailing and a clothing sales business in 2006. Since her husband left, she has lived alone, taking care of her children. As she believed in herself, she made her dreams come true. She has been increasing her income and paying the two boys' college tuition fees. 

Narantuya is a brave and active woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing commodities in large quantities so that I can increase the business volume and save for my third son's college fees." The total amount she is requesting is 500,000 MNT to buy commodities in large amounts.

loans.use: To buy commodities in large amounts

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a 25-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is two years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a small shop where he sells phone accessories and provides M-pesa (money transfer) services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a fast growing slum area  and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy phone accessories. His business goal is to own several such small shops within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy phone accesories.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, composées de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zambougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de l’arachide et de chaussures.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                
La cliente AMI, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 30 kilos d’arachide avec les revendeurs sur place pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 4 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’arachide.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo Group are wives and widows, are on average 28 years old, have four children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of Zambougou, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative province in Mail).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They sell groundnuts and shoes.

The women of the Djekafo Group are on their second group loan.

Ami, standing second from the right, intends to purchase 30 kg of groundnuts from the retailers in town in order to sell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to make average monthly profits of 4,000 FCFA of which she will use part to tend to the needs of her family and part to reinvest in her groundnut selling business.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo, trabaja independientemente elaborando cotillones (son gorritos, serpentinas, mixturas, hechas de papel de diferentes colores, que se usan para fiestas infantiles y otras celebraciones) y también cuenta con una tienda donde los pone a la venta.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material para la elaboración de más cotillon, papel, cartón, cartulina, goma, plastoformo, etc., y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos para la mantención de su familia.
Arturo, es viudo y tiene cinco hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la décima primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la octava vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Arturo works for himself making party favors (these are party hats, party streamers, and other things made from different colored paper which are used at children's parties and other celebrations).  He also a store where he sells these.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of material for making more party favors: paper, cardboard, card, glue, polystyrene, etc.  In this way he can increase his income to support his family.

Arturo is a widower and has five children with whom he lives in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood in La Paz city.

This is his tenth time working with IMPRO, and his eighth with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase paper, cardboard, card, glue, and polystyrene to continue with his business making party favors.

loans.name: Javzandolgor

texts.en:
Javzandolgor is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and a son in Bayanhongor province in South-Western Mongolia. Her husband is employed as a driver. Javzandolgor  worked at "Eastern Light" company as a cook from 2001 to 2010. She started a garment retail business in 2008. Also, she ran a catering service business since 2010. Now the garment retail business has been successful, due to her research on the local need on the field. She brings the supplies from a border city of China, which offers thousands of stylish choices for her. The business is famous for its quality and price. 

Javzandolgor is a hardworking woman who says, "I would like to take this loan for the business to purchase products wholesale from China." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy garments from China.

loans.use: To buy garments from China

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki is 32 years old. He lives in a village of Khelvachauri District with his family: his wife – Sopiko, their 5-year-old son, 2-year-old daughter and his mother. The family earns a living through their agricultural business. They have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Sopiko sells milk on the local open market. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns 0.3 hectares of land, where vegetables and fruit trees are grown. Sopiko and Akaki sell harvested products on the local open market as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Akaki requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With three milk cows the family will get 50% more milk and the income of the family will increase. Increased income will be used for purchasing needed household goods, to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Hurelbaatar is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and a son in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the baby. He has been running a business repairing shoes since 2008. He owns a small counter where he runs the service. He gained many regular customers who appreciate the service he supplies. 

Now he is planning to improve the business activity by purchasing some necessary equipment for the business. Hurelbaatar is a  easy-going man who says, "I would like to purchase some necessary equipment for the business to improve the business activities." The total amount he is requesting is 3,100,000 MNT to buy shoe repair equipment.

loans.use: To buy shoe repair equipment

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a single man. He describes himself to be effective. Previously, he was involved in transportation services and was a supplier of fruits. He operates a retail stall where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located within a densely populated residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of bags. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase bags. His dream and goal is to develop his business within five years.

loans.use: to add to his stock of bags.

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a 41-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 16 years. He describes himself to be honest and aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells bread and milk. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located within a fast growing slum and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fluctuating prices of bread and its high prices. 

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more milk and bread. His business goal is to be a supplier. He hopes that in the future, he will provide his children with the best education by paying school fees for them.

loans.use: to add a stock of loaves of bread for selling.

loans.name: Iashar

texts.en:
Iashar is 53 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri District with his family: wife – Natela, 22-year-old son and 18-year-old daughter. Natela is a housewife. Iashar’s son works in a local security service provider company. His daughter is a student. Iashar is a worker in the village. Along with his main job, Iashar is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, the family owns 0.4 hectare land, where vegetables are grown. Also they have a milk cow. Natela produces cheese and sells it on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 GEL. 

Iashar requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows, Natela will be able to produce double the amount of cheese and increase the income of the family. They plan to reinvest their increase in income for further expansion and development of the family business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mkambe

texts.en: Mkambe is a married woman who has nine children, six of whom are enrolled in school. She earns a living by buying and selling goats in a local market. She's worked in this business for four years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are the general public. Mkambe's other source of income is farming. She describes her greatest business challenges as thieves  and livestock that die before reaching market. Her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Mkambe will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy more goats. She hope to continue expanding her business by buying more goats in the future. She joined Yehu to secure access to affordable financial help.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin is a 50-year-old man, married with two children.  He has bred cows for the last 10 years. When he was close to pension age, he decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is about 230 AZN, and this business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for this 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase one milk cow and fodder. This will be his fourth loan, and AqroInvest CU trusts him.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Vijay

texts.en: Vijay is 30 years old man, married and the father of two children.  For the last eight years, he has earned a living by breeding cattle. After several attempts to find job, he gave up and decided to start his business. He buys calves when they are still small, then raises and fattens them for 5-6 months before reselling them in a local livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 1,000 AZN and his business is the only source of income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan because people use it in everyday dishes. Vijay wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. He has applied for a loan for 1,500 AZN loan to buy two calves and a cow that will produce milk.

loans.use: to buy two calves and one cow for milking.

loans.name: Wilton Roberto

texts.es:
Wilton tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad y esta estudiando, vive con su familia en el municipio de  Puerto Cortes.
Wilton hace 6 años tiene un negocio de pulpería. Lo estableció hace 6 años con fondos propios  y vende productos alimenticios como carnes, pastas, granos básicos, embutidos, lácteos etc. Manifiesta que este negocio sus ingresos son rentables ya que son productos que se venden a diario.
Es su primer préstamo con ODEF de 12, 000 lempira el cual lo necesita para comprar  producto para su negocio como carnes, granos básicos, golosinas etc. Para ofrecer variedad de producto a sus clientes.
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilton is 31 years old.  He is married and has a nine-year-old son who attends school.  He lives with his family in the town of Puerto Cortes.

For the last six years, Wilton has a had a convenience store.  He set it up six years ago with his own funds, and he sells food products such as meat, pasta, basic grains, sausages, dairy products, etc.  His income from this business is profitable, and he sells his products daily.

This is his first loan with ODEF.  It is for 12,000 lempira, which he needs to purchase products for his store such as meat, basic grains, candy, etc., so as to provide a variety of products for sale to his customers.

His goal is to grow his business so that his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase meat, basic grains, candy, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man. He has two children and both are enrolled in school. His wife is involved in a tailoring business. He operates a bicycle garage and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his greatest business challenge to be customers buying on credit, with long repayments, and his highest monthly expense is school fees. 

Ali owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ali will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare parts. He aspires to expand the business by buying more spare parts in the future. He joined Yehu because it has good policies.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Purevhuu

texts.en:
Purevhuu is a 38-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and takes care of their 2-year-old son. The oldest child goes to kindergarten. 

Purevhuu started a freight transportation business more than 10 years ago. He has experience in the field and plans to further expand the business activity and increase the volume. This is the only income source for him and his family. In order to keep the business, he needs to replace the wheels of the truck. The wheels have been broken down and so far, his family is in a tough financial situation. Purevhuu is a responsible man for what he is doing and says that "I would like to replace the wheels in order to keep it normal and develop the activities in the coming years." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to replace the wheels.

loans.use: To replace the wheels on his truck

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 to 25 years. She describes herself to be honest. Margaret operates a grocery stall where she sells items such as onions, tomatoes and fish (Omena). She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located near a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of proper storage facilities for the items sold as many of them get bad before they get sold. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more tomatoes, omena and onions. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler and supplier.

loans.use: to add stock of onions, tomatoes and Omena (fish).

loans.name: Sahin

texts.en:
Sahin is a 57-year-old man, married with eight children! He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 15 years. During these years, Shahin gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable as fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Sahin usually sells his crop in the central bazaar with the help of his son. His monthly income is 80 AZN.

As his products are in high demand, Shahin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1,200 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert was born on the 12th of October in 1962.  He is married and they have six children, three of whom are below the age of fifteen. He lives in a four bedroom apartment with his family in the Ndamukong neighborhood in Bamenda town, in the North West Region of Cameroon.
    
He is a carpenter by profession but does other business activities like his poultry and piggery. He said he is doing this carpentry trade because it is a trade he learned and he has experience in it. He also trust his handwork, judging from the community’s recommendations. 

As to the livestock business, the market trends are a driving force to his engaging in it, since the demand for poultry and pork products is steadily witnessing a rise. With this loan he plans to buy more wood for his carpentry workshop, as well as piglets, fowl and pig feed. 

He says, "My carpentry business helps the community in that people will be able to live in decent homes, because my work is affordable. Regarding the livestock business, it is going to improve the nutritional intake of my community members, thus healthier lives. Its by-products are going to provide manure, which is better in its environmental impact than artificial fertilizers. With the profits from the loan, I will continue the improvement of my family's educational and healthcare needs.
      
Gilbert prefers GHAPE because they offer loans at very low interest and with a convenient repayments duration. They also offer free trainings on business techniques and marketing skills as well as other life skills.  In fact, he says, a whole lot on human development skills.

loans.use: to pay for wood, piglets, fowl and pig feed.

loans.name: Verious

texts.en: Verious is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugokho, which is located in Uganda's Mbale region. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the past 10 years, she has been working hard at her small business, which involves selling clothes. To help expand this business, she is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to resell, and to help generate enough profits to pay her children's school fees. She hopes that in the future she will be able to become a larger clothing supplier, and is currently a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Verious who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Assimiou

texts.fr: Agé de 26ans, Assimiou est un homme célibataire. Il est électricien et revendeur à la fois. Il vend des articles d’électricité et des portables à toutes personnes dans une boutique.  Il achète les produits à Lomé. Activité qu’il a démarré en 2010. Il sollicite ce second crédit afin d’acheter des articles d’électricité et des portables. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité et avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en: Twenty-six years old, Assimiou is not married. He is an electrician and a reseller at the same time. He sells electrical items and cell phones to all types of customers in a boutique. He buys his products in Lomé. He started his busines in 2010. He is requesting this second loan in order to buy electrical items and cell phones. He wants to reinvest in his business and have a happy life.

loans.use: to buy electrical items and cell phones.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 56 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 28 years, William has been working hard to manage his stationary shop, which does art and design in making school uniforms. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making uniforms and will help William to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. William hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like William, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making uniforms

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Altanchimeg is a 36-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in Dornogovi province in Southern Mongolia. Her children study at the secondary school. She started a taxi service business in 2007 after she completed the driver's course. It has been 5 years she began driving, and during those years she became experienced in the field. Sometimes, her husband helps her business. She owns a van with 5 seats. 

Now she plans to start a new business, an automat game center. Altanchimeg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to start this business activity which was researched a lot by me. I thought it profitable and a good idea for a business. I am willing to run the business with my husband." The total amount she is requesting is 2,600,000 MNT to buy the equipment and machinery of an automat game center.

loans.use: To buy equipment and machinery for her automat game center.

loans.name: Firdovsi

texts.en:
Firdovsi is a 30-year-old  man, and married with two children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last 4 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it.  

He usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplant, peppers and tomatoes. He sells crops in the central bazaar and the monthly income from this business is about 150 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family. His wife helps him to raise crops and look after the land.

Now Firdovsi would like to invest more capital in his business to purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for 1,200 AZN. Since this is the only source of income in his family, he hopes this loan will improve their lives. This will be his fourth loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a married man and the father of nine children, two of whom are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer while he operates a kiosk where he sells wheat, maize and rice. He's worked in this business for two years, and sells mostly to the general public. Raphael's greatest business challenge is customers who buy on credit, and his greatest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. He will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy more wheat bundles, maize flour and rice to sell. Raphael aspires to expand his business in the future, and joined Yehu to secure low-interest loans.

loans.use: to buy wheat, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme âgée de 48ans. Elle est veuve et a 03enfants. Deux vont à l’école. L’ainé à 25ans et le dernier 16ans. Elle est restauratrice et vend à tout le monde à la maison. Son activité a été démarrée en 1994 et elle est à son troisième crédit de WAGES. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des denrées alimentaires pour son restaurant. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant et assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé is a 48 year old woman. She is a widow and has 3 children. Two go to school. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest 16 years old. She is a restaurant owner and sells to everyone from her home. Her business was started in 1994 and she is on her third loan with WAGES. She is requesting this loan to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant. She wants to reinvest in her business by expanding it and ensuring a glowing future for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Víctor Giovanny

texts.es:
Víctor, ha tenido la necesidad de seguir creciendo y superandose, quiere invertir en el negocio de lubricantes, por esto se ha motivado por un nuevo préstamo, el cual invertirá en lubricantes para automóviles, esto le ayudara para mantener un negocio estable, lo necesario para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a complementar el pago de una motocicleta, hoy en día se encuentra atendiendo este negocio y espera seguir superándose.
texts.en:
Víctor needs to continue growing and succeeding.  He wants to invest in the lubricant business.  That is why he has been motivated to get a new loan.  He will use the loan to invest in lubricants for automobiles.  This will help him to maintain a stable business.  This is necessary in order to keep his customers satisfied.

The previous loan helped him finish paying for a motorcycle.  He now tends to this business, and he hopes to continue his success.

loans.use: to buy lubricants for automobiles.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children who are 8 and 4 years old. Both of them go to school.  He earns a living by selling cosmetics and clothes. He has been in this business for five years and now has one employee. He learned about Finance South Sudan from a radio advertisement as well as from marketing and promotion done by our officers.  He is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, including powder, second-hand clothes, specialty clothing and cosmetics. Muhamed has no source of income other than this business. His goal is to build a good house for his family within five years. His major challenges are a low income and the high cost of goods in South Sudan.  Muhamed is very grateful for the capital he is receiving from Finance South Sudan.

loans.use: to buy power, clothes, cosmetics and other items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past three years, Stella has been working hard to manage her small pharmacy, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and add more capital in her business. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Stella  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kankele, composées de mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de chaussures, du tabac local et du bois de chauffe.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kankele sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments (pour la restauration), des chaussures, du tabac et du bois de chauffe.                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente FATOUMATA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, assise sur une chaise compte acheter deux sacs de chaussures en plastique avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les vendre sur place à domicile et en ambulante dans la ville de Konobougou à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de chaussures.
texts.en:
The women of the Kankele Group are wives and widows, are on average 41 years old, have three children, and live in large traditional families in the city of Konobougou, in Baroueil Prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative province of Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They run restaurants and sell shoes, tobacco, and charcoal. 

The women of the Kankele Group are on their thirteenth group loan which will be used to purchase seasonings (for the restaurant businesses), shoes, tobacco, and charcoal.

Fatoumata, the client second from the left, seated in a chair, intends to purchase two bags of plastic shoes from the whole-sellers in Bamako to resell in town from her home and in the streets of Konobougou to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA of which she will use part to cover her family's needs and reinvest part into her shoe-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Wassiou

texts.fr: Mr Wassiou est homme âgé de 25ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il est maçon et revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique depuis 2009. Il vend seul et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché. Il est à son second crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale(sucre, tomate, riz, détergent). Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité en l’agrandissant afin d’avoir une future vie maritale.
texts.en: Mr. Wassiou is 25 years old.  He is unmarried and has no children.  He is a mason and has sold general foodstuffs from a small shop since 2009.  He sells by himself and his primary challenge in competition in the market.  He is on his second loan and is asking for this loan to purchase foodstuffs (sugar, tomatoes, rice, soap).  He wants to reinvest in his business and expand in order to marry in the future.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs.

loans.name: Edwin Geovanni

texts.es:
Edwin, solicita un nuevo préstamo para surtir el negocio, comprándose accesorios para celulares, cargadores, carcasas y nuevos estilos de celulares, esto le ayudara para mejorar la variedad y mantener el negocio surtido con nuevos productos.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le dio una buena experiencia en la superación con el negocio, manteniéndose rentable y preparado para atender a los clientes, mejorando su nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Edwin is requesting a new loan to stock his business.  He will buy cell phone accessories, chargers, cases, and new styles of cell phones.  This will help him to have a greater variety.  It will also help him keep the business stocked with new products.

He feels that the previous loan gave him good experience in improving with his business, keeping the business profitable, and being prepared to tend to the customers.  This improved his level of sales.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories, chargers, cases, and new styles of cell phones.

loans.name: Laku

texts.en:
Laku is a 27-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children between the ages of 4 and 1. One of his children goes to school. 

Laku runs a food store business, and he has been in the business for three years. He has no employees. Laku heard about Finance South Sudan from radio advertising as well as marketing and promotion done in his area by the officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SDG to purchase more items like maize flour, wheat flour, etc. Laku has no other source of income. 

In five years, Laku would like to build a good house for his family. His major challenges include bringing the foodstuffs from another country to South Sudan.
 
Laku says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like maize flour, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Mwachidofu

texts.en:
Mwachidofu is a married man. He has eight children, four of whom are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. Mwachidofu operates a goat business and sells his goods at the market. He has worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are slaughter houses.

 Mwachidofu's other source of income includes his wife's earnings. He describes his greatest business challenge to be that the animals at times get lost. His highest monthly expense is school fees. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwachidofu will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more goats. Mwachidofu aspires to expand the business and open a butchery in the future. He joined Yehu because of their lower loan lending interest rates.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is 37 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Abdallah has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Abdallah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Abdallah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Abdallah hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Abdallah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdallah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 33 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and increase her inventory. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a tailoring business. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, composées de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de N’Tjifina, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce des habits, du poisson, de l’arachide et des condiments.                                                                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente DOUSSOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter une dizaine de complets d’habits pour enfants avec les revendeurs de Nangola et Fana pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala Group are wives and widows, are on average 37 years old, have three children each, and all live in large traditional families in the village of N’Tjifina, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region in Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.

The women in the Kotognontala Group are on their third loan.

Doussou, the client standing second from the left, intends to purchase a dozen full child outfits from the wholesalers in Nangola and Fana to then resell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 5000 FCFA, of which she will use part for the needs of her family and part to reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: La señora Esperanaza tiene 48 años de edad es integrante y tesorera del grupo "Emmanuel" que conforma 7 miembros, ella es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos es independiente y la otra es una joven estudiante, nos cuenta que es Cosmetologa y que trabaja en un salon de belleza cerca de su casa, gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo esta apoyando a su hija en el pago de sus estudios, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, tambien nos cuenta que se a comprado su auto y lo esta haciendo trabajar para un ingreso mas en su economia, con el ultimo prestamo lo va utilizar en compra de materiales de cosmetologia en el futuro piensa realizar su sueño de poner un salon de belleza en su casa.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 48, is a member and the treasurer of the Emmanuel comunal bank, which is comprised of seven members.  She is divorced and has two children.  One of them is independent, and the other is a student.

She tells us that she is a cosmetologist, and that she works in a beauty salon close to her house.  With her work effort she is helping her daughter pay for her education.

In her free time she sells clothes by order.  She tells us that she also purchased a car, and she is making it work for an extra income.

She will use the loan to buy cosmetology materials.  In the future she plans to make her dream of establishing a beauty salon in her house come true.

loans.use: to buy cosmetology materials.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
Julio, quiere seguir realizando sus cultivos de maíz, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para el pago del alquiler de parcelas y la compra de abono, semilla, herbicidas, con esto estará en condición de iniciar su trabajo en la tierra.
El tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, realizo su compra y la producción estuvo buena, además con su familia se  ha mantenido haciendo unas mejoras en la casa y cuenta con mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio  wants to continue producing his corn crops.  He has decided on a new loan to pay for renting plots of land and for the purchase of manure, seeds, and herbicides.  With this he will be set up to begin working his land.

The previous loan had a positive effect.  He made his purchases and his production went well.  In addition, he has been able to keep making some improvements to his home with his family, and has higher income.

loans.use: to pay for renting plots of land and for the purchase of manure, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат трудолюбивый и умный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 2-х лет он занимается продажей DVD дисков. Имеет арендованный магазин. В бизнесе занимается сам и имеет помощника, который получает заработную плату. Помимо того он предоставляет услуги компьютера и ксерокопии, который приносит ему дополнительный доход. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Шухрат запрашивает займ для покупки DVD дисков и оборудование для копирования дисков. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Shuhrat is a hardworking and smart person.  He is married and has three children.  He has been involved in selling DVDs for over two years.  He leases a store.  Shuhrat is involved in this business himself and has an assistant, who earns a salary.  Besides this, he provides computer and copying services, which bring in an additional income.  Shuhrat's wife is involved in household work.  Shuhrat is requesting this loan to buy DVDs and equipment for copying discs.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy DVDs

loans.name: Mukhamadjon

texts.ru: Мухамадчон женат и на воспитании имеет троих несовершеннолетних детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Мухамадчон занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Он успешно продолжает данный бизнес более 2-х лет. У него собственный трактор, который помогает в переработке земли. Мухамадчон запрашивает займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений, горюче-смазочных материалов и запчасти для трактора. Мухамадчон надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mukhamadjon is married and has three adolescent children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mukhamadjon is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He has been successfully running this business for over two years.  He owns a tractor that helps him to work on the land.  Mukhamadjon is requesting this loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants, and spare parts for the tractor.  Mukhamadjon relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, sont toutes des femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zambougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits, de condiments et  de beignets                                                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des habits, des condiments et des céréales (pour faire le beignet)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
La cliente MADENI, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 10 habits pour enfants avec les revendeurs du marché de Nangola pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce des habits.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala Group are all married, are on average 40 years old, have four children each, and live in large traditional families in the village of Zambougou, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative province of Mali).  They know each other through kinship ties, as neighbors and friends.  They sell clothing, spices, and beignets.

The women of the Kotognontala Group are on their second group loan, which will be used to purchase outfits, spices, and grain (to make the beignets).

Madeni, the client sitting first from the left, intends to purchase 10 outfits for children from the wholesalers from the market in Nangola to resell them in the village to a clientele of men and women.  She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 5,000 FCFA of which she will use part for family needs and part to reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase outfits.

loans.name: Idibek

texts.ru: Идибек женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он  трудолюбивый и добрый человек, который старается создать уют в своей семье и обеспечить своих детей. Он является строителем. С 1998 до 2000 года он находился в  России вместе с братом на заработках. Затем вернулся домой и продолжил свою работу. Данный момент Идибек запрашивает займ для ремонта своего дома, точнее для штукатурки, установки окон и дверей. Идибек надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Idibek is married and has four children.  He is a hardworking and kind person, who always tries to create comfort for his family and provide for his children.  He is a construction worker.  Idibek and his brother worked in Russia from 1998 to 2000.  Then, he returned home and continued his work.  Currently, Idibek is requesting this loan to repair his house, specifically for plaster and windows and doors installation.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Juma has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Juma to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Juma hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Juma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities

loans.name: Roxana De Jesus

texts.es:
Roxana, quiere invertir más en el negocio, por eso se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en ropa nueva como camisas, pantalones, ropa para niños, pues quiere tener surtido el negocio y poder realizar mejores ventas.
Su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue buena, incrementando su inventario y las ventas, esto tambien le ha dado una mejor solvencia económica con su familia.
texts.en: Roxana wants to invest more in her business so she’s decided to request a new loan to buy new clothes like shirts, pants and children’s clothes because she wants to have her business well-stocked to have better sales.  Her experience with the previous loan was good; she increased her inventory and her sales which have led to better economic solvency for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, de 31 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 9 y 10 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Choloma, Cortes junto a su familia.
Oscar, tiene aproximadamente 15 años de dedicarse a realizar trabajos de sastrería donde elabora prendas de vestir para hombre como ser: pantalones, trajes, short etc y reparaciones de ropa.  Eventualmente realiza trabajos de soldadura y mecánica automotriz. Este negocio de sastrería lo inicio con su propia iniciativa y esfuerzos  propios.   
La necesidad de obtener ingresos suficientes para el hogar ha decidido iniciar otro negocio de pulpería para vender productos comestibles de la canasta básica familiar como ser: granos básicos, refrescos, carnes, azúcar, sal etc. para el cual está solicitando a ODEF un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras. Este es su tercer préstamo solicitado. Su esposa le ayudara con la pulperia. El plan es incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Oscar, 31, is married and has three children who are 3, 9 and 10 years old.  He lives in a village in Choloma, Cortes with his family.

Oscar has been working for about 15 years doing tailoring jobs; he makes men’s clothes like pants, suits, shorts, etc. and he also repairs clothes.  Occasionally he also works doing welding and car repairs.  He started the tailor shop with his own initiative and with his own efforts.

The need to earn sufficient income for his home has led him to start yet another business: a grocery store to sell basic staple items like basic grains, soft-drinks, meat, sugar, salt, etc. that he’s asking ODEF for a 10000 lempira loan for.  This is his third loan request.  

His wife will help him with the grocery store.  The plan is to increase sales and family income.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues quiere comprarse semilla de marañón cruda, esto le permitirá tener lo suficiente en el inventario, para poder procesarla y ponerla a la venta.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con su préstamo anterior, invirtiéndolo todo en el negocio y dándole una mejor capacidad y ventas.
texts.en: To continue investing in the business, María is asking for a new loan because she wants to buy raw pecans so that she can have sufficient inventory to process and put up for sale.  She obtained a positive effect from her previous loan investing all of it in the business thus obtaining better capacity and sales.

loans.use: to buy raw pecans.

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат занимается продажей тканей и женской одежды на рынке.Она в возрасте 61 года, замужем. Имеет 5 детей. Более 30 лет клиент занимается  этим делом. Она покупает товары с «Атуш базара» г. Кайраккума и с Истаравшана, и  продает их на  местном рынке. Её муж на заработках в городе России. Ибодат  кредитуется с 2006 года, и не разу не нарушала условия организации и целенаправленно использует полученные кредиты. На полученный кредит клиентка хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Ibodat is involved in selling fabrics and women's clothing at a market.  She is 61 years old, married and has five children.  She has been in this business for over 30 years.  Ibodat buys her merchandise at the "Atush Bazar" in the city of Kayrakkum and Istaravshan and sells it at the local market.  Her husband works in a city in Russia.  Ibodat has been obtaining financing since 2006 and has not once violated the organization's conditions and has used her loans as intended.  She wants to use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing

loans.name: Maria Trancito

texts.es: María de 27 años vive (duran Guayaquil) ella empezó este negocio desde muy pequeña , ahora que ya está casada y con su esposo decidieron poner la venta de fritada . Tienen su local pero la dificultad que tienen es que es muy lejos de su casa. Es casada tiene 4 hijos menores de edad . A futuro ella anhela terminar su casa. Con el préstamo comprara (cemento, pintura ).
texts.en: María, 27, lives in Duran, Guayaquil.  She started this business when she was still little.  Now that she’s married she and her husband decided to open a fast-food store.   They have their locale but it’s far from home.  She’s married and has four minor children.  In the future she’d like to finish her house.  She will use the loan to buy cement and paint.

loans.use: to buy tile and cement.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 38 лет, замужем,  воспитывает 5 детей.   В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1996 году Назгул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Назгул, ее поголовье в хозяйстве на сегодня насчитывает 8 дойные коровы,8 бычков и 4 овцы, что приносит  около 20,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazgul is 38 years old, married and has five children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1996 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Nazgul's persistent and hard work, today her livestock headcount includes eight dairy cows, eight bulls and four sheep, and yields about 20,000 som (KGS) in monthly profit.  In order to further develop her business, Nazgul requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Divino Niño Jesus actualmente se encuentra en el 8º ciclo, son 17 integrantes de mujeres sacrificadas y por sobre todo muy trabajadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
 La Sra. Natividad es una de las integrantes que se siente beneficiada con el programa de la fundación. Ella se dedica a la producción de artesanías en general y así va generando los ingresos que necesita para ella y su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, telas, agujas y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo sus artesanías y dándole a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Child Jesus) committee is in its 8th cycle with 17 self-sacrificing, above all hard working, women members who very much want to get ahead and help each other.

Natividad is one of the group members who feels benefitted by the Fundación’s program.  She makes crafts in general and this is how she generates income she and her family need.

She asks for the loan to buy thread, fabric, needles and other supplies to continue making crafts and giving her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: En el hogar las mujeres parecieran tener una dotación especial de fortaleza que las hace invencibles.  Pueden dedicar cualquier cantidad de horas a trabajar incansablemente hasta alcanzar sus objetivos. Así es la señora Maribel ella tiene 45 años de edad. Ella pertenece al grupo  María  Elena Moyano y está conformada por siete integrantes, tiene con el grupo 7 años. Es mamá de una hija y su familia fue la mayor motivación para trabajar. La  satisfacción que le ha dejado al trabajar en la compra y venta de productos textiles desde  hace 15 años, es ver a su hija que a culminado sus estudios universitarios. La señora Maribel aseguró que ahora va a iniciar su segunda etapa, lo que significa que pondrá invertir sin ningún problema, ella en el futuro le gustaria poner un restaurante con la ayuda de su hija.
texts.en:
At home, women seem to have a special endowment of strength that makes them invincible.  They can spend countless hours working tirelessly to reach their objectives.  This is how Maribel, 45, is.  She belongs to the “María Elena Moyano” group which has seven members; she’s been in the group for 7 years.

She’s the mother of a daughter and her family was her greatest motivation to work.  The satisfaction she’s gotten from working 15 years buying and selling textiles is seeing her daughter complete her university education. 

Maribel assured us that she’s now about to start her second phase which means she will be able to invest problem free.  In the future, she’d like to open a restaurant with help from her daughter.

loans.use: to buy textiles.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
El Comité denominado Perpetuo Socorro actualmente se encuentra en el 13º ciclo,  son señoras con aspiraciones y deseos de trabajar, habitualmente todas se dedican en la artesania y con el incentivo de generar ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
La Sra Avelina es una de las integrantes que mayormente se dedica a la artesania con lo que puede darle a su familia todo lo que ellas necesitan para el día a día. Ella está muy agradecida y orgullosa por ser parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras mediante eso ella puede exclusivamente dedicarse a su actividad que es sumamente importante para ella.
Esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas, y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo las artesanías que vende.
texts.en:
The committee called “Perpetuo Socorro”  (Perpetual Help) is in its 13th cycle.  The women have hopes and the wish to work.  Mostly they are craftswomen aiming at earning income to improve their quality of life.

Avelina is one of the members who mostly does crafts that allow her to give her family everything they need day to day.  She is very grateful and proud to be part of the Enterprising Women Program which makes it possible for her to dedicate herself exclusively to her work which is most important to her.

This time the loan request is to buy thread, needles, fabric and other supplies she needs to be able to continue making the crafts she sells.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, needels and other supplies for crafts.

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es: Cesar de 37 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil) . El converso con su papa y llegaron a una conclusión que por el sector pasaban buses grandes y que no había vulcanizadora entonces decidieron instalar una vulcanizadora. El se dedica a su vulcanizadora pero aparte hace taxi amigo y le va bien en las dos cosas. la dificultad que ella tiene es la delincuencia . a futuro el anhela mejorar su negocio . Con el préstamo comprara ( tubos, llantas  )
texts.en: Cesar, 37, lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  He talked to his father and they reached the conclusion that large buses passed through their sector but there was no tire repair shop so they decided to open a tire repair shop.  He works in his tire repair shop but also provides Taxi Amigo service; he does well in both things.  The difficulty he faces is crime.  In the future he’d like to improve his business.  He will use the loan to buy inner tubes and tires.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо занимается продажей тканей на рынке. Ей 40 лет, замужем. Имеет троих детей. Более 15 лет клиент занимается этим видом деятельности. Она покупает товары с «Атуш базара» г. Кайраккума и с Истаравшана, и  продает их на  местном рынке. Её муж на заработках в городе России. Мархабо  сотрудничает с нашей организацией 2003 года, и ни разу не нарушала условия организации и целенаправленно использует полученные кредиты. На полученный кредит Мархабо хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свои условия жизни.
texts.en: Marhabo is involved in selling fabrics at a market.  She is 40 years old, married and has three children.  She has been involved in this business for over 15 years.  Marhabo buys merchandise at the "Atush bazar" in the city of Kayrakkum and Istaravshan and sells it at the local market.  Her husband works in a city in Russia.  Marhabo has been partnering with our organization since 2003 and has not once violated the terms of our organization, and has been using her loans as intended.  Marhabo wants to use this loan to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Duo Perlas De Ramirez Group

texts.es: Duo perlas de ramirez.Doña Marta tiene 55 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos comestibles nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque este credito lo esta solicitando no solo para agrandar mas su negocio si no tambien para tener mas capital para la compra de productos comestibles su meta es darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ramírez Pearls Duo

Marta is 55years old, married and has four children.  She’s been selling foodstuffs for 10 years.  She tells us that she’s very happy because this loan she’s asking for is not only to expand the business more but also to have more capital to buy foodstuffs.  Her goal is to give her children a better future and to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Las Flores De Buenos Aires Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Flores De Buenos Aires” es un grupo nuevo, la cual está conformado por  11 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa-Prosperidad. Paula tiene 64 años de edad es viuda con 08 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de verduras y tubérculos, la cual lleva más de 20 años en dicho negocio. Paula es una mujer trabajadora, y se siente orgullosa de ello, pues con su esfuerzo a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Contar con un local propio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos  es su mayor deseo. A fin de seguir mejorando su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar papas, cebollas, tomates, y verduras y así tener que  ofrecer a sus clientes. La nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Flores De Buenos Aires” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The “Las Flores de Buenos Aires”  communal bank is a new group.  It’s composed of 11 enthusiastic members ready to start working with Programa-Prosperidad.  

Paula is 64 years old, widowed and has 8 independent children.  She is a vegetable and tuber street vendor; she’s had the business for more than 20 years.  Paula is a very hardworking woman and she’s proud of that because she’s been able to provide education for her children through her efforts.  Her greatest wish is to have a locale of her own where she can sell her products.  

Aiming at continuing improving her business, she asked for the loan to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables in order to have something to offer her customers.  

The new “Las Flores de Buenos Aires” communal bank are grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Silvana Leticia

texts.es:
Silvana es una joven mujer de 20 años. Es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por sus paisajes. "Santo Domingo" pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Esta joven emprendedora trabaja desde hace 4 años preparando comida y vendiéndola en un centro de concurrencia de personas. Trabaja 6 días a la semana un promedio de 6 horas al día. Este último año se ha visto afectada por el alza de precios en los víveres. Ella no ha podido subir los precios a sus clientes por lo que su margen de ganancias ha disminuido. La estrategia que Silvana ha pensado es renovar sus utensilios y enseres, de tal manera de que la nueva imagen atraiga mayor clientela y así tener mejores ingresos. Con ello quiere mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella ama a su trabajo, por ello quiere que su clientela se sienta mejor con el cambio y poder servir a nuevos clientes. Su sueño es poder crecer en este mismo negocio
texts.en:
Silvana, 20, is a young, single woman; she has no children.  She lives in Santo Domingo which is one of Ecuador’s youngest cities.  It’s built at the point where the mountains and the coast meet.  It is a privileged spot not only because of its ethnic richness but also because of its scenery.  

Santo Domingo currently belongs to the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province which was recently formed.  Santo Domingo’s main fiesta is celebrated with an intense influx of visitors and with commercial and cultural interchange.  A large fair takes place in the cattlemen’s  association grounds where the best examples of various breeds and crossbreeds from the region’s haciendas  are exhibited and compete.

This young entrepreneur has been working for the last four years preparing food to sell at a place where many people congregate.  She works six days a week on average six hours daily.  

This past year she’s been affected by the rise in foodstuffs prices.  She’s not been able to raise her prices to customers so her profit margin has declined.  

The strategy Silvana has thought up is to upgrade her utensils and equipment so that a new image will attract more customers and her income will improve.  She hopes to improve her quality of life this way.  

She loves her work and this is why she wants her customers to feel better with the change and to be able to serve new customers.  Her dream is to be able to grow in this same business.

loans.use: to upgrade her kitchen utensils and equipment.

loans.name: Los Jasminez Group

texts.es:
La Sra. NERY ELIZABETH de 40 años de edad casada tiene 02 hijo menores de edad, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “LOS JASMINEZ” grupo conformado por 09 personas. 
NERY ELIZABETH se dedica a la venta de carne de pollos al por mayor y menor vende en el mercado de su localidad, el préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar su balanza electrónica y otros.    
Sus objetivos para el futuro es comprar otro puesto de venta de carnes y pollos. Ella se ubicada la primera persona  lado izquierda parte superior de la fotografía viste con chompa color anaranjado y  chaleco color rosada.
texts.en:
